The machines pay o.k. but I am not much of a gambler anyways.

Sep 8 2009 	Very very average and not a walking distance to the strip	We stayed there for 4 nights - i am not big on fancy shmancy hotels, this one is average -normal rooms, nothing outstandig, counld have been cheaper than what we paid. Hotel's casino is definitely not the best one in Vegas and i do not recomment waisting any time there... Location is not good - too far from the strip, however, you can get around using public bus, which comes every other 20 minutes... Buffet was quite good, but nothing really esle to admire. I would recommend searching for some better/same price deals closer to the strip!

Sep 7 2009 	ANother good visit - but casino / public areas in need of a little TLC	This is the fourth time we have stayed at the Stratosphere in the last 5 years. We like it here because it is quieter then some of the big strip hotels and has provided easy access to expressway, downtown etc that you don't get down on the congested part of the strip.The check in this time was much quicker then any of our previous visits (which is a good improvement as we have waited up to 45 minutes before). We booked an NWA world vacations room with our airfare (worked out to about $25 per night + the resort fee charged for the two night stay of $7.50 per night). Cheap accomodations. We were give some sort of an upgrade as we ended up in a mini suite with a separate sitting area in a regular size hotel room - divider wall - was a nice room, clean with two tv's and a fridge. It was clean and comfortable as we have come to expect here. Great valueThe pool area is now much nicer then the adequate pool area from last visit. They have spent some money on new surroundings and chairs and it shows. Enjoyable simple pool area.As my title suggests though - the rest of the resort - from the casino to public areas is slipping a bit and showing signs of age. The casino itself is much less fun then before wtih many of our favourite games missing - it is much more sparsely filled with video poker / slots then last visit - although we did like new 'video blackjack' game where 6 or 7 people sit around big screen to play real rules blackjack. Washrooms, tower area, common areas are all starting to age and less clean (especially washrooms) then last visit. Fortunately we found cocktail service to be as good as before (one reason we come here) - way better then other strip hotels and almost as good as outlying hotels and downtown hotels.Good visit - recommend for cheap, comfortable accomodations.TIP: If you are gambling at the stratosphere - use your points / comps at Arizona Charlies - owned by same group but the comps go a lot further at other locations - free breakfast most days from gambling the night before on our way out to see the town - decatur or boulder depending on which direction you are going. The comps don't go far (if any) in Stratosphere and to be quite frank we have not found the food or restaurants to be that good at Strat anyways - so we usually eat elsewhere with ACG coupons.

Sep 6 2009 	Excellent accomodation with everything at your fingertips	We stayed in the Romance Suite and were pleased with how luxurious the room was. The bathroom alone with it's spa bath was the size of a small unit and the king size bed was very comfy. It also had a sofa bed and two tv's. We also had a bar fridge and coffee machine.The whole room was very big and was more than enought size to fit my Husband, myself and our five yr old.I loved the fact that the stratosphere had everything at our fingertips. My son loved the Mcdonalds , the buffet was excellent and Roxy's dinner was great service and wonderful food. The other food outlets on the shopping floor were also very tasty and affordable.While staying there we had the opportunity to see the American All Stars show which was brilliant. We also enjoyed the viewing deck on the tower. We however were not brave enough to try out any of the thrill rides.We also loved the fact that the bus which takes you along the strip was just outside and was very convenient.The only down side to our stay was the laundry facilites. While it was great that they were free to use, there were not enough dryers and out of the ones they had only two worked and dryed the clothes properly. I unfortunately had one that took over 3 hrs and my clothes were still damp even after being on the hottest setting. The other thing I felt the hotel lacked was shade at the pool. We enjoyed the pool but as for umbrellas to shade the chairs they were few and far between and sitting near the pool soon became very hot and uncomfortable expecially when trying to rest and watch your kids.Overall our stay was wonderful and would stay here again

Sep 5 2009 	Great value for money	Recommended to single travellers and groups of friends. This hotel is located on The Streep, but at least 20 min from most of the other Casino hotels. The hotel offers convenient shuttle service to the middle of the Streep (Planet Hollywood hotel) and back. You can save time and money taking this shuttle instead of walking to major hotels or taking "crawling" Duece service . The pool is great. The hotel has lots of enterntainment, restaurants, cafes and bars. The bar on the ground level offers unlimited drinks between 4 p.m. and 8 p.m. for $20. Great deal! The hotel is very close to the Premium Outlet Mall (5-7 min cab ride) and the monorail (5 min walk) and downtown.

Sep 3 2009 	Pretty good for a 3 star	a group of friends preselected this hotel and therefore I booked the same hotel.I think, considering the hotel is a 3star, it is pretty good value for money. It may not be the most glamouros hotels in Vegas but they are only a short taxi ride away (or 20mins by foot).Rooms are a decent size and clean - not the trendiest furniture (throughout the hotel that is) but the bed was comfy, bathroom always clean.When I stayed in March they just opened the new pool which looked pretty good from top of the Stratosphere Tower (compared to the other old, existing one)Staff was very friendly, the casino downstairs not very glam but good enough to lose a few bucks at the end of a good night out.When I stayed in March they just opened the new pool which looked pretty good (at least what I could see from on top of the Tower)Since you don't need to sleep much when you go to Vegas - this hotel is more than good enough to drop of your suitcase and go back to shower and change clothes!PS: I dare you do the rides on the Stratosphere tower! :-)

Sep 3 2009 	Reasonable hotel but a little distance from The Strip	We recently stayed at the Stratospher Tower in Vegas.Check in was easy as we were the only ones there. On arrival we were offered an upgrade to a room with a strip view. It was not that expensive so we said yes. However on getting to our room we found our strip view was blocked by the large signiature tower at the front of the hotel. So if you are offered this on check in please confirm with them which room you will get as it may be possible that your view will also be block. Our strip view was very limited.The room was a double queen size room. Good size but furniture was dated. Apart from the two beds, we had a table and two chairs. The TV was and old CRT TV and was housed in an old cabinet. Think 60's and you will get the picture.The room was also a duplex room so it had a door joining the apartment next door. Although locked, we could hear everything that was going on from the talking to the TV going on, which did so every morning at around 5. Either early risers or late to bed? Regardless of this, it would be wise to ask if your room is a dual entry room in order to avoid this.The staff were friendly. The restaurants in the hotel were well decorated, and clean. The hotel is a little distance from the main hotels on the strip and you can either take a walk which can be up to an hour, and bear in mind it was 40 C when we were there, this can be hot and tiring. Failing that you can get a day ticket on the Deuce which is a but that travels the length of the stip and allows you to hop on and off as you like. A day ticket is US$7 or a three day ticket US$15. Well worth it.The hotels here are amazing, and I think next time I would recommend staying on the strip though be aware that a lot of the major hotels have major clubs within them, so they may be noisy. We walked past one, I think the Venetian and it has a club which looks out onto the stip and you could hear it so not sure how far this noise would travel in the hotel. All in all it was a pleasant trip. Lots of shows to see. Just be careful of the gambling as it is easy to have your money eaten up.The strip during the day is pleasant. At night the people wander around with their drinks and seem quite drunk and it gets loud and a little roudy. Daytime crowd much better.From Vegas we did a day trip to the Grand Canyon and Hoover Dam. Long day of about 14 hours but worth it.Oh and internet at the hotel is expensive. US$5 for fifteen minutes.

Sep 2 2009 	Stratosphere didn't refund reservation fee	I booked a suite January 2009 for our trip August 2009. But by July we found a better deal for Excalibur Hotel. I cancelled the Stratosphere reservation and received an email confirmation with the cancellation number. I trusted that the reservation charged to my account was going to be credited back. Credits reflect on credit card accounts in 3-5 business days and I got busy I totally forgot to check back. September 2, I saw a charge from Stratosphere hotel on my credit card for $2.84. The first time I called their accounting department the person I spoke with told me the charge was for something authorized at the front desk but she doesn't see what for. I told her we cancelled the reservation and never stayed at the hotel. She was very rude. She said she didn't see that the reservation was cancelled and that since this is the first time it happened, as a courtesy she will credit my account. Courtesy?!?! I told her I could give her the cancellation number I got from email. But she declined. After we hung up I called back to speak to the front desk manager to see what was the charge for and was told that since the reservation was never cancelled on their system I was charged for one night plus taxes. Meaning the reservation fee of $103 was never credited to my account and the $2.84 I saw just charged was for taxes. And the accounting person told me she'll credit me $2.84 as courtesy?!?! For sure she had seen in the system I was charged for one night! I called accounting again and this time had to be angry at them to give me back my money. This 2nd accounting representative was also very rude. She hung up on me after she angrily said my account will be credited back. I had to call back to ask her to send me an email confirmation from her that my account will be credited back. They make you feel like you were trying to cheat them when infact they are trying to cheat you. Not even an apology from them. What a customer service!I'd NEVER even consider Stratosphere Hotel the next time we go to Vegas. To think we usually go there as a big group.

Sep 1 2009	Nice with a touch of mold and cigarettes...	My recent stay at the Stratosphere was ok. It could have been great though. I work for an airline, and was able to take my Mom to first trip to Vegas. Looking online, we decided on the Stratosphere because of the prospect of a great view. We arrived at the hotel without a hitch by taking one of the many pay shuttles that are at LAS. The cost was $16.00 (one way). We arrived at the hotel, and checked in, and then went on up to our room which was in tower three on the tenth floor. Upon exiting the elevator, we were bombarded with the stench of mold and stale cigarette smoke. I did not complain to management or anyone concerning this, but I did mention it in the survey they ask about.If you are traveling with children to Vegas, be careful of this hotel. They have two swimming pools, one is topless and they say that its adults only. Ways to get around? If youre on a budget, go with the Mass Transit. You can get a 24 hour access pass to the buses for only $7.00!

Sep 1 2009 	Just AMAZING ; we'll be back for sure !!!	We stayed at the Stratosphere from august 22 to 26 2009. We chose a TOWER PREMIER room, which was situated on the 21st floor with a view of the Strip. We were more than pleased by the room itself : it was very clean, well decorated, with a big bathroom... We paid a little price for our stay at this hotel and the room was over our expectations.The SERVICE was the major positive point of this hotel : everyone is smiling, caring, and making sure that you are satisfied. The room was cleaned perfectly and different personnal touches were left in the room every day (extra towels, extra lotions or shampoos, extra pillows...). The concierge desk is useful, with competent employees that will help you no matter what you're looking for. We also ordered room service a couple times and the food was always excellent, the service amazing and quick, and they even called 15 minutes after the delivery to make sure our order was OK. The menu is available 24hours and there is plenty of choice, from sandwiches to more elaborate meals like Dijon salmon in pecan crust or a 12 oz T-Bone. If you feel like having a cozy and relax evening in your room, trust the room service for your meal, you won't regret it.The VALET PARKING is just the best thing. Every hotel in Vegas offers free valet parking. But at the Strat, we were served by nice and competent employees, ready to give us information about the city or directions. It is well worth the tip.The casino is less crowded than at the other resorts, it is not smoky at all and big enough to please anyone. It is not as glamourous as the Bellagio's casino, but hey : at least you're not walking on the feet of a bunch of tourist that only came to your resort to visit it. As in many casinos, the drinks are free, as long as you're playing...We went to the Top Of The World restaurant and enjoyed a nice dinner with a splandid view of the Strip. It is a bit pricy but you expect that from a classy restaurant. Try the Duck Ravioli with the Foie Gras : it's EXCELLENT ! We also accessed to the Tower's observation deck and did the rides (BigShot and X Scream). There was no waiting for the rides and they are a thrill of a lifetime ; don't miss that.Some people say that the Strat is far from everything : that's not true. It is at the north end of the Strip, so yes, if you don't have a car you will walk a lot to get to the south end. But we kind of enjoyed being a couple blocks away from the noisy, crowded, traffic jammed mid-Strip at night time. We rented a car so it was not a problem. And even if you don't have a car, there are a couple of monorails (some free, some expensive), there is plenty of taxis and also buses... You're never out of options.In other words, is we ever go back to Vegas (which is almost certain), it is sure that we won't hesitate to book at the Stratosphere. We visited the Bellagio, the Wynn, the Mandalay Bay... They are gorgeous, but you have to manage yourself through the lobby surrounded by hundreds of tourists in their flip-flops taking pictures at every step... I wouldn't pay that much money for a luxury resort in Las Vegas. They are just TOO crowded and you won't enjoy the things you paid for. Stick to the Stratosphere, you will be pleased !

Aug 31 2009 	Wicked couldn't ask for more!!	I spent 15 nights in the Stratosphere this month and it was brilliant. This was my second trip to Vegas and this time i wanted to be 1/2 way between the strip and Fremont and thats what i got. On my last visit i stayed in the Terribles and that was a good hotel also but was much further away from Fremont it was closer to Sams Town. The room was fantastic it was of a good size and the beds were so comfortable i found it hard to get up on a morning. The staff were friendly at the front desk and the housekeeping staff were lovely, my room was cleaned daily if i requested. The pool was brilliant as well as the topless one at the top of the hotel. Women go free woo hoo, i do not like bikini lines. But be aware of the perves that pay $10 to watch you! Ice machine was on every floor and free. Lifts were very spacious and the quickest ones i've been in. Make sure you take using your room key to the best advantage because you can get to the top of the tower to watch the rides for free, others have to pay a fee and also the gym is pretty neat.The only downfall to this hotel is where it is based for some people, you have to walk a little to get on the strip. Not that i mind this, but my feet did at the end of my trip with all of their blisters. The monorail is very good in Vegas but it's a shame that it only go's so far, if it done the full route of the duece my feet would not have suffered so bad. That is my main concern of Vegas the transport, especially the deuce(bus) it take approx one hour to get down the strip.If you go to Luckys you can even get a takeaway, which is good if you do not want to eat in. I loved the vegetable spring rolls and chips with chilli sauce. AddictiveIf i stayed in Vegas again i would stay in this hotel. The staff and my room fely like home, i didn't want to leave.

Aug 30 2009 	Great restaurant horrible casino... View was worth it but not the place to hang out otherwise.

Aug 30 2009 	Great hotel for the money a bit away from the action	The hotel was clean, staff was courteous and it felt very comfortable and safe. Breakfast buffet was great, lunch not so much. you can walk about 4 blocks to the really fun parts of the strip, but you might not want to do it late at night. Rooms were really comfortable. The pool was nice but again, nothing great. I think that there are obviously much nicer places to stay in vegas, but the cost of this for the quality was really great. We got a free trip up to the tower for all in the room. I think you can ride the 3 rides for all day for 45 dollars or so.

Aug 27 2009 	Great for the $$$	It has been a while, but, I have stayed @ the Stratosphere twice now. It is a bit away from the other hotels, however, you can get a 24hr. bus pass for $7, that takes you the length of the strip including Freemont St. (old Vegas).If you are just using the room to sleep and shower, it's great. I wouldn't stay @ this hotel if I was goint to be spending an extended ammount of time in my room. It's clean, cheap, the pool and bar area are fun, and the staff is friendly and efficient.I also did not see many children at the Strat, which I thought was great. Vegas is about gambling, drinking, and partying. It's definately NOT a place for kids. Disney is a better choice for a family vacation.I have also stayed @ Treasure Island and am staying @ Mirage this year, but, I would not rule out the Strat for future trips due to the savings factor alone.

Aug 27 2009 	AMAZING HOTEL GREAT VALUE	The Stratosphere is a ffantastic hotel & great value due to its location just off the main strip.We got a taxi to the strip which wasn't very expensive. Rooms were huge with lovely big bathrooms & great views of strip from panoramic windows. Nice big pool area with space to sunbathe.Scary rides at the top of tower, I managed 2/3, the rollercoaster that hangs over the edge was awesome!! dont think about it just do it!!!!Literally never sleeps, people sit in the casino all day & all night!Did a fab helicopter trip over strip & the trip to Gand Canyon is well worth the money, even though its a very early start!Overall this hotel is great value for money compared to other hotels in Vegas & as you can go in every hotel anyway I would stay here again.

Aug 26 2009 	My 30th Birthday Celebration	The room was nothing like the picture. I wasn't expecting the Ritz but the room was old and our view was of the garage. Only local channels,no real cable channels. I am so glad that we bought a Timeshare further down the strip. We will be staying there anytime we come in.

Aug 24 2009 	Do Not Stay Here!	After reading many reviews on this website because we had never been to las vegas we decided to book 8 nights at this facillity. I can tell you I was extremely disappointed with the hotel in numberous different aspects. First off if you look at the stratospheres website it looks like a totally different place than what it acutally is. It is acutally very very far from any activitives you are going to want to do which are all located in the central area of the strip and this hotel might as well be in downtown. It is located in a very bad part of town. It costs at a min. $20.00 for a cab ride to places like the flamingo or anything central. The cabbys laughed when we mentioned the area and said that it is very bad they call it naked city because all the strippers used to lay on the roofs of the houses there but now its all run down and very bad. The hotel is very old as well and needs updating. The room was supposed to be a " suite " for our wedding honeymoon stay and it was FAR from a suite! Was very small, the "jetted tub " was pathetic, old and nasty! The A/C was probably the worst part. It is designed in such a way that it faces the wall not you!! It also is controlled by motion censors that turn it off when the air either reaches temp or there is no motion in the room. Well, at night time there is no motion and it is horrible. And when you are out all day and night and you come back to a hot room it is very frustrating. They came to the room said there was nothing they could do and that was it. The next morning after sweating all night we tried to get a room change. We explained to them it was our honeymoon and we expected a " suite ". They seemed ver understanding and said that would take care of it no problem, they would move us at no cost to us. They showed us a room that was GREAT! It really was a true suite. My wife loved it and started packing our bags. I went back down to finalize everything and was told it would be no problem that it would be another 150.00 for the weekdays and 300.00 a night for the weekend. I became frustrated and asked to speak to a manager. The manager just smiled at me while she continued to state that same thing as the last rep. My wife got mad and we decided to check out of the hotel right then.They seemed to not even care if we stayed there or not. We moved our wedding party to the flamingo and had a very enjoyable time. The good things about the stratosphere were the roller coasters although they were somewhat pricey, what isn't in vegas. Also, there is a 50's diner in the hotel where they sing every few minutes it's pretty neat. Anyway, I would highly recommend ponying up the extra cash to stay at a more centralized location. Enjoy!

Aug 24 2009 	not bad but a little bit to far on the strip	we spent there 3 night in august. The price was really competitive, that's why we picked it. but pay attention as it is located far north on the strip so you'll have to take a cab or bus to get to the other well know hotels and casinos (by the way, the bus always gets stuck in the traffic so it may take 30 mins to get to the centre of the strip). our room was nice, clean and spacious. we also liked the swimming pool and there's also a free gym for the hotel guests. finally, do not use their internet stations: most of the time they do not work but charge you anyway (it happened twice to us and we had to go to the reception to get our money back). Free parking.

Aug 23 2009 	Fantastic suite great value for money - but Las Vegas not for families	We stayed 2 nights in a Romance Spa suite (huge room and bathroom with jacuzzi) with a connecting 2 queen bedroom for our kids, on the 16th floor, for less than the price of a Holiday Inn in LA. So great value for money, and staff were efficient if not particularly friendly. Our 11 year old loved the 'extreme' rides at the top of the tower, and we saw an amazing magic show at the Sahara next door, complete with disappearing tigers.BUT!! I'd wondered whether to include Las Vegas in our fly-drive of California/Arizona (yes I know it's in Nevada, but you get the picture). I'd heard that there was more to Las Vegas than gambling, drinking and shopping. that it was now 'family friendly' - well don't believe it! To start with the hotel: you can't avoid crossing the (enormous) casino floor to get to the restaurants, the tower, the shops etc. It's smoky and seedy (grim-faced loners playing the machines with all their luggage next to them....) If the kids so much as stopped for a second to look at the roulette table as we crossed the floor to have breakfast, we were pounced on by the security guards and told to keep moving. The 'family' pool area has practically no shade, in temps over 95, and again, when we went within 10 yards of the bar to order food, we were barked at by the barman. The major Strip hotels (Forum, Circus Circus, Bellagio etc) are amazing to see. But overall, I found the extravagance depressing, and the atmosphere totally un-family friendly. I couldn't wait to leave and get to the Grand Canyon. Now there's a real wonder of the world, made by God not property developers.Conclusion: if this is the kind of thing you like, you'll love it. Just don't take your family.

Aug 15 2009 	Great value for your money....clean hotel very comfortable beds	I prefer to stay a bit off the strip. The hotel was great for what you paid. Aug 15 2009 	Great hotel for the price!	After reading some of the reviews for the Stratosphere, we were a bit apprehensive about staying here - especially as we got a midweek deal for $15 per room per night.Needn't have worried - rooms were roomy and clean, even though we were in the less plush "Tower II" part of the hotel. However, all of the parking on the strip seems to be free so we just drove and parked and saved ourselves the bus fare. Stratophere Hotel was best bargain of the holiday!

Aug 15 2009 	Can't beat it for the money	July 27th, 2009 We stayed at the stratosphere after making our reservations online. Don't forget about the pool on the 8th floor---but go early or late because the sun can be brutal in the afternoon sun. Book your rooms Sunday through Thursday and save the money.

Aug 14 2009 	Excellent quality for a low price. Tower views are outstanding and the attractions!	We could only stay 2 days but we left very happy! You cannot skip going to the top of the tower! Views and Xtreme attractions are amazing! I will be back!

Aug 13 2009 	Total Value	I was surprised that the hotel was so nice. The quality is comparable to a Best Western, Holiday inn, La Quinta etc. The staff were very nice (except for one problem) and when we had a problem with our room we were given a free upgrade no questions asked. Although it is out of the way, you can catch the Deuce tourist bus right outside the front door or walk 1.5 blocks to the Shara and jump on the monorail, it takes about 10 minutes to get to the busier part of the strip. ---We had a room with a jacuzzi that overlooked the living room in our suite and you could watch tv from the tub. This was a very good value - got it for 36/night.

Aug 12 2009 	Excellent Hotel...3* price tag with 5* service...	After reading the bad reviews about this hotel, all I can say is that they must have stayed in a different Stratosphere to the one we did!! If they wanted a 5* Hotel in the middle of the strip...thats what they should have booked! We saved a substantial amount of money over the fortnight compared to the prices of the central strip hotels. It was our first time in Vegas so we had nothing to compare it to, but we couldn't fault the hotel...it is what it is...a 3 star hotel, not trying to be anything its not. From check in to check out, every staff member we spoke to was friendly, attentive and nothing was too much for them. I'm sure the tipping made a difference but you all know how it works in the hospitality industry! Our room was very clean, housekeeping were always present around the hotel throughout the day and if you left a DND sign on the door in the morning, they would leave a voicemail for you to call them when you were ready for the room to be serviced. The pool area was great, complimentary towels and always plenty of sunloungers no matter what time you went out. Fair enough there weren't any designated swimming lanes BUT...your on holiday not practising for the Olympics!! The staff were great around the pool and the food was really good. They have a great choice of restaurants, we ate in Fellini's, the food and service was perfect. We also had food in the Top of the Tower restaurant, we had lunch instead of dinner because it was half the price, the food was nice but still expensive. It's worth going there though for the experience of being in a revolving restaurant 800 feet high. We didn't have chance to eat in Roxy's because the queues were always too long..which speaks for itself! Very popular. The observation deck is free and unlimited for hotel residents, definately the best view of Vegas. The rides are not free; they are $15 for each ride. When we checked in we were given $5 free slot play each which was a nice touch and from that we won $23 between us. We watched 'American Superstars' in the hotel which is half price for hotel residents. The show was a lot of fun and great value for money at only $19.99 each. The hotel is a fair walk from the strip but its definately worth doing it at least once to take everything in. We didn't use the Monorail, just the Deuce bus service which has a stop right outside the Casino side entrance. At $7 for a 24hr access pass it is definately worth the money and we used it almost every day. We never waited longer than 15 minutes for a bus and the drivers are very entertaining to! The Fremont Experience is close to the hotel and you can get the Deuce there aswell. Only advice is to avoid the Deuce if your in a rush to get somewhere. We decided to get a cab to and from the airport so we didn't have to make any stops or changes, it cost us $40 the day we arrived because of roadworks but only $20 on the journey back to the airport. The only negative comment I can make is that we were approached a few times for spare change when we walked to the general store. As long as youre polite and stern, they just thank you for acknowledging them and leave you alone. However, this is no reflection on the hotel just the area it is in. We hope this review helps you if your planning to stay at the Stratosphere, you can still go and see all the other more expensive hotels, you just know when you put your head down after a long day...your still in Vegas and paying a lot less than everyone else for the same experience! To put the money we saved into perspective, we were able to watch David Copperfield, Jay Z, American Superstars, KA Cirque Du Soleil and go to the Grand Canyon!!!...not a bad sacrifice for staying in a 'supposedly budget' hotel ;)

Aug 12 2009 	Well worth it for the price!!	We stayed in the stratosphere end of july/start of august. after reading reviews here i was a little sceptical as reviews concerning check in and distance from the strip worried me a bit. if you are heading there soon, you have nothing to worry about!! we checked in around 5pm and it was easy and took around 10mins to queue,be served and be in our room so no complaints there. the room was modest (we had a oversized luxury studio), but we wasnt expecting anything major so the room was a pleasant surprise (comfy bed,fridge and it was clean - its vegas, how much time are you going to spend in your room?!) the distance from the main strip is a little way, but again, its been a little exaggerated by some on here. me and my girlfriend walked to the fashion show mall virtually every morning and it took around 25mins which after a night of drinking and eating was quite nice to do! the days where we didnt fancy the walk, the sahara is5mins from the strat and the monorail is easy to use and fairly cheap ($5 per ride or $13 per day) the restaurants in the hotel were good too,we ate in fellini's twice which was very reasonable and the service was great, roxys looked good fun-we didnt eat there but there looked to be a good atmosphere and everyone in there always looked happy! the bar in the hotel casino is also very friendly/fairly cheap compared to most on the strip and if you take advantage of the 4hr happy hour then you cant fail to have fun! the rides on top of the tower are a must too, very high but well worth it ($30 dollars for a tower pass and ride passes). the 8th floor pool is lively and fun, not too cold which has been the problem in some places .as its on the 8th floor it can get very hot in the daytime up there so we tended to get there around 5 for a couple of hours but again - who goes to vegas to lay around a pool all day-thats what spains for!!we had a fantastic time there - ok, its not as plush as the bellagio and its not perfectly located, but for the ridiculously cheap price, what more can you want from a hotel in vegas?

Rooms comfortable but a bit pricey for this end of Vegas.

Aug 10 2009 	Beware if you come here with kids !!!!	Went to the Stratosphere in July with my family on the "Breakfast Package". Booked two rooms which includes two breakfast buffets per room. Went down on the first morning only to be told that only people over 21 qualified for the included breakfast. A bit embarrasing and ended up paying again for the kids. Aug 10 2009 	Will absolutely never even set foot in this hotel again	The customer service is terrible. They are rude and dismissive. Their defense was "There was not note in the computer specifically stating they were not to be let in." If I took their name off, and changed the key, do I really need to say more for you to do your job and not allow 2 random people into my hotel?

Aug 10 2009 	Pleasantly Surprised!	My husband and I booked the Stratosphere for a week, August 2nd-9th, for a rest and relaxation trip. We have both been to Vegas numerous times so the location was not an issue for us. We got an incredible deal through Allegiant Air which we couldn't pass up, so decided to go for it and take a chance.We arrived at the hotel at around 1:00 in the afternoon, check-in went smooth and there was not a long wait. The check-in clerk was very nice, took extra time to go over the different rooms they had available. Hubby and I decided to upgrade to a Player's Club Room which only cost us an extra $15 per day. It had a brand new mattress, new bedding, updated decor and fridge. Our room was exceptionally clean (my only real "must have" in a hotel). Granted the room was not overly fancy by any means, but it was spacious, comfortable and clean (can you tell I like clean rooms?) In fact the entire hotel was incredibly clean. I was always seeing staff sweeping, dusting or vacuuming. Overall the hotel itself is modern and I did not get the sense of it being run down in anyway. Of course there was some wear & tear here and there but with the amount of people in and out of these mega hotels there surely would be!After getting settled we took a tour around the casino/hotel area in order to get familiar with our surroundings. It has four restaurants (Back Alley Bar and Grill, Fellini's, Roxy's Diner and Lucky's Cafe) a Starbucks and the buffet on the casino level and a McDonalds, Mexican restaurant, Ben & Jerry's, Fat Tuesdays, a Weitzel's Pretzel place and Chicago Style hot dog restaurant on the upper level. Also, there is the Top of the World restaurant high up in the tower. We ate at Roxy's Diner which had excellent food, great service and decent prices. The waiters and waitresses sing 50's & 60's songs which was a lot of fun! My husband acquired a new crush on Gidget, one of the waitresses at the diner. She sat next to him and sang a bit of a song while we ate! Too cute! We also ate at Lucky's Cafe which was also very good, great portion sizes, the prices weren't too bad and the food was great. We also tried the buffet one day and did the $19.99 All You Can Eat-All Day Long deal. It is a great deal that is for sure but we found that we over ate the entire day and didn't want to come home with an extra 10 pounds to lose! Overall, it was an okay buffet. The food was just so-so, however, they did have a great selection of different dishes so there is something there for everyone. We also ate at the Mexican restaurant upstairs. It was good as well, not the best mexican I have had but the prices were also decent and we received huge portions.Our main goal was to relax by the pool during the day and work on our tans. The main pool is on the 8th floor and has awesome views of the surrounding mountain ranges. We were always able to find a lounger, they have a vast amount of them surrounding the pool area. There is not a lot of shade to be found and there are only a handful of umbrellas for people to use for shade, so my advice would be to get there by 9:00 am if you want to secure an umbrella for the day. The pool area also have cabana's for rent as well. Monday-Thursday an all day rental is $50 and Friday-Sunday is $125. The cabanas were basic but they did have a mini fridge stocked with bottle water, a flat screen tv, two loungers, and free rental of the pool loungers. We did not rent a cabana because we were always able to find a quiet corner of the deck and an umbrella to use.The adult only pool is on the 25th floor. You must be 21 or older to go into that pool area because it is a European style pool (topless sunbathing). We decided to go check it out one day and we both just loved it. It became our hang out of choice! It was much quieter and had a more mature vibe to it. We especially liked it because there were no screaming kids! Pure bliss! The view from the 25th floor was amazing as well. The service was excellent as the bar tender got to know everyone at the pool because there were not very many of us. Great service by the pool attendant as well. When you arrive he asks you where you would like to sit, he takes the towels over to your seats, sets everything up for you and makes sure you are comfortable. Nice touch!The location of the hotel itself has some good points and bad points. If you are going to Vegas for your first or even second time, I would not stay here. I say this because it is at the very end of the strip and getting to the strip takes a long time. If you have the money in your budget to take a cab to and from the strip then it would be okay but if you are on a budget and will be taking The Deuce or are wanting to walk, think again. Hubby and I didn't mind it at all, grabbing The Deuce and just watching the sights as we made our way down to the strip was just fine. We have seen all the hotels and been to the majority of the attractions, so we were in no rush to be anywhere at any given time. The good thing about being at that end of the strip is you are sort of half way between the strip and Fremont Street, so catching the bus to either area was really easy and convenient. You are also over half way to one of the outlet malls as well, which was a very short bus ride from the hotel itself. One other thing we noticed was that because we were way off the strip, we could walk out of our hotel and walk down to the convenience store to grab munchies and alcohol without being stuck in massive crowds walking up/down the strip. It was a quiet area and everything we needed was right there - internet cafe, convenience stores, bus stops, Denny's, IHOP etc...very handy!!In the end, we both had a great time and achieved what we wanted from the vacation. We would not hesitate to stay at The Stratosphere again. The value for your money is there!

Aug 5 2009 	Our stay was perfect!!!	I must admit I was a little worried about staying here because of the location but my mind was put to rest when we pulled into the parking garage and security was patrolling the area on bikes (and keep in mind there were about 5-6 of them and at 3am). We ate at several restaurants including the diner, which was fun and Top of the World (a must try). We stayed in a suite one night and a standard room another night. The beds are comfortable and the linens are a clean, crisp white. The showers are hot and have good water pressure. The other thing we enjoyed about this hotel was that it has a very convenient lay out. There are many things for families to do here including a large swimming pool, small arcade and amusement park rides at the top of the tower. I highly recommend The Stratosphere. We will be back.

The rides had to be seen to be believed!There is an adequate gym in the shopping area. I gather it has been moved from the pool area. Well airconditioned and has towels and water.Yes the hotel is at the end of the strip but that is well highlighted by the reviews and website so it shouldnt be a shock to anyone booking this hotel! it just means a short walk to the Sahara to catch the monroail or the bus runs up and down the strip for 3 dollars each. The monorail is 5 dollars one way so can work out quite expensive. We walked the strip more often than not as you see more.We saw the hotel show American Superstars and Michael Jackson was fantastic. Very strange to see him and then meet him. Excellant double moves and looks wise.The area next to the hotel is a little dodgy but that is no different to anywhere in the world and as always you need to stay on your guard and be observant. There are lots of homeless asking you for money but all the ones we encountered were very polite.The launderette on the 6th floor is great and good that it is free but gets busy and in all honesty for the size of the hotel there should be 2 or 3 of them. Especially when washers break down, although mainetenance were very good and got the company in to sort them out.Internet is $11.99 for 24 hours which is steep in my opinion but we needed it.The hotel does get busier at weekends and there are more queues everywhere but that is to be expected. Talking of queues we had no problems checking in at all. There were 8 staff checking in and they were excellant and helpful.All in all we have had a fantastic time here as it was our first visit to vegas and the Stratosphere was everything we wanted. Dont be put off by the other reviews just book the hotel and keep an open mind. We did and we are very pleased with outcome.Thankyou Stratosphere!!!!!

Jul 23 2009 	A great place to stay.	It would be nice to be closer to the middle of the Strip, but with a rental car, that wasn't too big of a deal. We loved the views from the tower, eating our anniversary dinner at Top of the World at sunset.

Jul 23 2009	Where time doesn't matter...	The Stratopshere is a nice, clean, good value for money hotel. Many complain about the location but I personally thought it was a great location. Although it's the Northern most hotel on the Strip, it is only a 5 minute walk to the Sahara where you can catch the monorail to the main part of the Strip. And then when you fancy going downtown to Fremont Street (a must) it is only a short taxi or bus journey. Overall the service was ok, it varied from place to place within the hotel. The check in staff were nice and polite and helpful. Room service were quick and also polite. The staff in the gift shops were very helpful and always had a smile for you. The only two minor irks were a couple of waitresses in Lucky's were rather rude and the drinks ladies that come and bring you drinks when you're gambling were few and far between.The beds were made most days and clean towels were provided. We were in Tower 2 and had great views of the mountains, especially beautiful when the sun was going down. Most of our time during the day was spent lazing by the huge pool on the 8th floor. There were plenty of beds and a bar for when thirsty.During the evenings we ate at one of the restaurants in the hotel. Lucky's was nice, great selection of food, but as I said before, the service wasn't always up to scratch. Also, if you are in a party of more than 8 they automatically add 18% tip to the final bill, which is fine if you receive good service, which in some cases we did not! So we tended to split into groups of 6 and tip according to the service recieved as it was hit and miss. We also ate in the 50s style Roxy's Diner. It was always very busy as the service was excellent, the entertainment was good fun and the food was great. There was also the shops on the retail floor where you could pick up McDonalds, pizza, Mexican and all other kinds of take away. We never went hungry!The casino was ok, plenty of machines and tables to choose from. Played every day and never really won much but never really lost much either. The C-bar was nice to chill out in away from the machines if you just fancy a drink. The tower was brilliant. Amazing views. Plus it's free to go up there if you are staying in the hotel. I recommend going up there during the early evening and watching the sun gradually slip behind the mountains and at night when the Strip and downtown are lit up. Beautiful! We also went to see the American Superstars show, half price as we were staying at the hotel. It was good, Rod Stewart and Christina Aguilera had pulled out the night we went so a couple of the performers we didn't really know but Michael Jackson and Elvis more than made up for it.The rides at the top of the tower are fun, although I just watched, was too chicken to actually go on them! But you can go out onto the observation deck and stand in a lovely warm breeze while everyone else gets scared half to death.I would definitely go back to the Stratosphere. The location is great, it's good value for money and for the most part the service is good.

Jul 23 2009 	Average stay Bad Location	After staying at the MGM Grand for 2 nights this was a little disappointing.It is quite a long way up the strip so took a while to get to places.The room was very small and we were given 2 beds rather than the 1 requested.The bathroom was very small and the hand bason was outside in the bedroom.The pool area is very average and we much prefered the MGM grand river pool.I would pay the extra money to stay elsewhere

Jul 22 2009 	Great rates and rooms	My mother, niece, wife and I stayed here for a week in March and loved it. This is the second time we have stayed there and would highly recommend it to others. The cheap rates really helped cut the cost of our trip, meaning we could see and do more. The girls LOVED the spa! The location is great if you are renting a car to see other areas beside the strip. We'll be going back to this hotel for sure.

Jul 22 2009 	brilliant!	I visited Vegas in August 2007 with my mum and dad for my 16th birthday and I can overall say it is a brilliant hotel. The service was great, everyone was really friendly. The beds were huge and so comfy and our room looked right down the strip which was amazing! I definitely recommend Roxys Diner, we went there for a meal on the day of my 16th and the waiter spotted my 'Birthday Girl' badge and i was later dragged up in front of everyone else in the restaurant and sang 'you're sixteen, you're beautiful and you're mine' to me, so that made my birthday even more amazing. The view from the observation deck is stunning, Vegas is such a beautiful place at night time. It may be far up the strip but there's a bus stop just 2 mins away. I'm going back to Vegas again this August and staying at the MGM purely because we want to try another hotel but i very much recommend the Stratosphere!

Jul 21 2009 	GREAT CASINO GOOD FOOD GREAT SERVICE CLEAN ROOMS	Hi, I research every single place that I have ever stayed and actually didnt with this one so im leaving my review for others. So, we walked in, great casino area checked in, tower room smoking clean and great value for a hotel in vegas ( cuase really when do you sit in the hotel anyways) the sink are was small tho, shower was great, but bathroom small as well. The double queen beds filled with pillows, never seen cleaning lady but had do no disturb sign the whole time, but had towels when needed. I belive the italian restaurant felini's WAS GREAT best service, great food, not overpriced. oh and the caffee on other end was great for brekfast. cheap too. not too many people during the week, but weekends was filled with lots of babies and parents. hard to get on tables in the weekend. far location, but rent a car, taxi is not overpriced either. all in all for 6 nights flight and hotel costing me 800.00 I was THRILLED and would stay here again. ANYTIME! oh p.s they have two ppools one topless on the roof, and one inside. I didnt attend either, lol but pics are great!

Jul 20 2009 	Good rooms and service but the revolving hotel is the worst.	We got an upgraded room and the room was very good. Best hotel for what you spend. There is a fridge and 2 TV's. Jul 20 2009 	Excellent value poor location	I have stayed twice before in Vegas in more expensive hotels, so I was hugely surprised about the value of this very inexpensive hotel. Jul 20 2009 	great hotel	this hotel has great rooms very clean the pool area is great. pool and jacuzzi are good size. good pool bar there are pleanty of sunbeds the hotel is on the strip but right at the very end so the loaction isnt the best. the shows in the hotel were good and well priced i would stay at this hotel again freindly staff good pool area and great rooms make up for not the best lolcation.

Jul 18 2009 	I love the Stratosphere	My girlfriend and I have stayed at the Stratosphere twice, and we loved it both times. The first time we stayed we did not know what to expect, it was our first time in Vegas, and the employees of the hotel made our stay very enjoyable. The second time we stayed we both knew pretty much what to expect, and the hotel didn't let us down one bit. I will agree that it is far from everything on the strip, but you can buy a 24 hour pass from the duece (double decker bus) for $7.00 per person and you can access anyplace on the strip at any time. As far as being full all of the time this is not true, and yes it may get crowded, but that is everyplace in Vegas. I also like the fact that once I get to the airport, I no longer have to deal with my luggage until I get to my room at the hotel. I find a shuttle that is going to the Stratosphere, hire it to take me and my girlfriend and they take the luggage load it up, and once we get to the hotel the bell hop takes over. They give me a tag and when we get to our room all we have to do is make a call to the bell desk and they bring up our luggage. If you decide to stay at the Stratosphere get a players club card, I can not stress this enough. With this card you will get free yes free game play, free shows, and free food. You can also get your room for free, the second time we went, I didn't have to pay for the room at all because of my players club card. I am now waiting for my next offer, and I was told it would be a better offer (such as flight included). The shows are great and the food even better. The only thing I can say is that I will be back, and I will be staying at the stratosphere again.

Jul 15 2009 	Clean quiet a/c unit........but beige and bland	We stopped at the Stratosphere for 3 nights with our teenagers. Quick check-in was good, although we'd requested 2 rooms, one with a king bed and the other with 2 queens but they could only give us both rooms with 2 queens so was a bit disappointed there. Good sized rooms but no refrigerator and the ice machine on our floor was broken for our stay, meaning a short hop up to the next floor and back down (or vice-versa). Very reasonable room rates but charge for wireless internet was an absolute rip-off. The views of the strip were great. However, the view from the top of the tower/lounge/restaurant was breathtaking......we just went for cocktails but next time I'll book a meal in the Top of the World Restaurant with the revolving floor - I know it hasn't got a good review food-wise but that view will be more than worth it. We booked the 'Bite' show which was quite good and different from what I was expecting. The bar has a $10 minimum on the poker machines for free drinks, but the drinks were strong so not bad value really. Roxy's Diner @ the Stratosphere is good fun - bit on the expensive side but good for snacks, drinks and staff karaoke. The buffet in the Stratosphere (I think it's called Plate) is excellent value, especially for breakfast - just remember to take your room card with some ID too or they won't let you in. I found the location to be ok, the deuce pass is quite good value and the stop isn't far from the hotel so you can hotel-hop for 24 hours all for $7- not bad at all.

Jul 15 2009 	OK just a bit busy	The good: location (everything within walking distance ;-), nice panorama, friendly staff. The room was alright, although the bathroom could have been a bit larger.The bad: don't go there if you want to have a relaxing evening. Remember, it's Las Vegas and so it is quite busy there.

Jul 14 2009 	Excellent Gaming!!!	I stayed at the Stratosphere for a 3 night stay this July. I initially booked a Premier Tower room, but once I checked in, I asked about an ugrade to a Suite. I ended up getting an Executive Suite for a total of $200 more for all 3 nights. Altogether, the move was worth it as the Suite offered better strip views and such comfortable space to relax in the room. The only drawback was that it came with a King size bed (ok for couples) and a pull-out sofa bed. Between my buddy and I, that worked and we each had our own bed. Our room was in the Premier Tower on the 24th floor (top floor), located nearby the Private Pool on the 25th floor. he housekeeping was superb (Irene) and she made sure our place was always clean and new bed sheets.The gaming was excellent. The tables were always at $5 (most, if not all) and the Pit Bosses were so friendly, always encouraging to drinks and joining the Ultimate Rewards program that the hotel offers. What I specifically enjoyed were the people visiting and gambling there. There were many folks that are avid Startosphere gamblers/visitors. They seem to like staying there and gambling there. After my strip, I did too. I plan on returning later this year...

Jul 14 2009 	Hotel is Fine Location is terrible	When I booked this hotel it was through a flight/hotel package on Expedia and I was looking for price over location. That turned out to be a bad idea. The hotel is perfectly serviceable. There was nothing wrong with the room and I enjoyed the casino. It is just so far down the strip that you have to take cabs everywhere. It is nowhere near any public transportation, at least not close enough so that I'd want to walk. I'd recommend staying at either Flamingo or TI, both centrally located and reasonably priced. Cabs there are also so expensive you're just better off paying $50-$100 more total for the hotel b/c you'll spend at least that in cabs.

Jul 11 2009 	Great Family Value	We spent 4 days here with my two teen age children just prior to our wedding at the Bellagio. For the last 2 days we were joined by the "Mom's" (my mom and my soon to be mother in law). It was a great place for our needs-the kids loved the tower and the thrill rides, the McDonalds and the pizza place on the shopping level were big hits and even the mom's enjoyed the view from the indoor observation deck. We had a rental car and parking was easy. I definately recommend the Premier Tower rooms-access to the garage is quick, Starbucks is right at the elevators, and also access to the shopping level is easy. The best part was you don't have to walk across the casino every time you come and go. We have stayed in both towers and the Premier is definately better. Our room was clean and the staff was good at keeping it that way, despite 2 messy teenagers and their exploding suitcases. The pool area was great, although the really loud holiday weekend dj was a little bit much. We were always able to get lounge chairs and it was never too crowded. Again, getting there from the Premier tower is super quick-just an elevator ride to the 8th floor. Our room was nicely decorated with 2 queen beds and a decent sized bathroom-roomy enough for the 4 of us to all be there at the same time and not fall over each other. (again, much larger than the World Tower rooms). The rooms have been remodeled and look it. We had a view of the jumbo tron on the front of the building, the thrill rides above and a bit of the pool area. We ate at Roxys and Luckys and also frequented the Starbicks in the casino, where service is super fast. The kids really enjoyed Freemont Street. We also visited Red Rock Canyon, which I highly recommend. We want to go back in either the fall or early spring when the weather is more conducive to hiking. There's a new visitor center opening at Red Rock in the fall of 2009. We also ate at the nearby Tiffany's Diner, which was great, cheap and easy to get to. The White Cross Drugstore (Where the diner is located) sells very reasonable supplies-tooth paste, post cards, shampoo, even alcohol. We bought a styrofoam cooler for $2 to keep bottled water and drinks in our room. It worked out really well. Overall, the Stratosphere is a great value for families. We will go back with the kids again.

Jul 10 2009 	ok for price - location not good	Stayed 3 nights in a premier non-smoking room (and the room smelled of smoke!). Very spacious room with 2 queen beds and spacious bathroom. V clean.Location is not good as you are at the very far end of the strip away from everything. There is a bus that goes up the strip but it is extremely slow and takes an eternity to travel up the strip. There is also a monorail which is a 10min walk from the stratosphere but I didn't get this.The pool was good BUT they play music there the whole day and it is really loud so reading or listening to your ipod is nigh impossible. This was pretty annoying.Buffet in hotel is good.Overall, this hotel was really cheap and good value if you don't mind having a bit of a trek to get to the main part of the strip. If I went back, I'd pay more and stay closer to the strip.

Jul 7 2009	Good value... but I'll look elsewhere first	The rooms and the hotel in general were very clean. The tower was amazing--easily the best view of the strip. The location has its pluses and minuses. It is definitely too far to walk to the main strip, but if you rent a car and you plan on getting out and about quite a bit, the location is great due to easy highway access and no strip congestion. The people... eh... not so good. They were not rude, but they could have been more helpful. If I ever go back, I will avoid the "World II Tower" at all costs. I don't think I will stay in that thing if they try to drag me up to the room. The elevators to the tower were terrible and, everyday, during peak periods, I was stuck waiting forever and then riding in a packed elevator. Awful. Also, the room had no view... literally. The view out the window was of a wall about two feet outside the window. The pools were shallow, but nice and not overly crowded. And the parking was great... very convenient and only a short walk to the inside of the hotel.The price was quite good, but with the price, we got what we paid for too. Next time, I will definitely pony up the extra $10 per night to stay elsewhere, but this was still a good deal.

Jul 5 2009 	PICK ANOTHER HOTEL	We were very disappointed with the hotel. The good thing was the price of the room and the buffet deals but everything else was a big mess. There was no minibar or fridge in the room even we paid extra for the upgrade. The swimming pool area's music is so loud that impossible to be there. Jul 4 2009 	Unbelievably good for the price	I booked my stay here on wotif.com for the bargain basement price of US$40 for a Saturday night, one night stay. I did get charged the resort fee on arrival, which I think was $8 - but in the grand scheme of things, this still made my stay affordable at under US$50.I arrived just before midnight so check-in was very quick. Parking was easy in the self park and not as far away as some other casinos. I arrived and drove straight down to catch the last Fremont St Experience show of the night, this was good - a very laid back vibe (the bar at Golden Nugget looked like fun). As it was quite late I found food options limited (true of everywhere in Vegas though) and ended up getting McDonalds.I stayed in a standard room (didn't pay extra for the premium tower), and I thought room was very good. 2 queen beds which were very comfortable. Room was on the far side of casino and seviced by seperate elevators, just FYI as this wasn't a problem for me.Everything was clean and worked, bathroom also (hairdryer provided).I breifly went to the pool (adults only) on level 25, not particualrly fancy but good for some sunshine and relaxation. They did play rather loud music though which, at 10am, was a little much. This pool is optional topless (men have to pay an entry fee), there is another pool on level 8 for families.Stratosphere is located right at the North end of The Strip, if you're aware of this you can plan accordingly - I stayed one night here, and spent it at Fremont St - then spent 2 nights in the centre of the Strip. This way of breaking up your time in Vegas is udeful in cutting taxi/bus costs and walking time. My stay was absolutely fine, no problems at all.

Jun 30 2009 	another level of holiday	this hotel is 2 1/2 miles from the center of the strip(main action)the main strip is 41/2 miles long.we used daily ticket mono rail,cheap, bit of a chew. still a lot of walking, to do. can try bus but always full.taxis not cheap what ever any one says.we would not recomend walking to this hotel,it too long a walk.you WILL be pestered by tramps as you leave main strip,,just politly walk on.....once in the hotel its very big,easy to get lost inside.the lift to the roof (and very scary rides) costs $9 just to look,it might be worth it once,.........we got free tickets to shows from shop owners but you must be a bit cheeky and ask,ask. i found the free shows in the hotels great, get a time table of free shows and attractions and walk in.....the hotels are mainly the same beds ,food ect,so try and get central. good luck

Jun 27 2009	Great stay at the Stratosphere Hotel - highly recommended !	We 2 stayed at the Stratosphere this last Tuesday and Wednesday nights, after having booked the deluxe room ($30/night) just last Sunday morning on travelocity. Just before that I had read a review on this webpage about an armed robbery at the Circus Circus Annex (motel-style buildings behind the CC towers). I had to cancel my existing reservation at the CC Annex. The Stratosphere is a really nice place; our room on the 11th floor in the Premier tower was clean and elegant. The 2 beds were set up higher than normal (a plus for us taller people) and the comfort level for sleeping on these beds was top-notch. The pool on the 8th floor was clean and refreshingly cool. We were there at 8 AM,quiet and not crowded, but the sun was already high and intense...over 100 degrees. Hotel check-in and check-out was a breeze, the staff there were pleasant and helpful.We enjoyed several buffet meals there, at 25% off for adult hotel guests. You can have the all-day buffet special at $20. Now I read the recent review stating the $5.99 breakfast special at Lucky's (?) Restaurant - wish I had known that earlier. At any rate the buffet had a good selection of all kinds of food items. The only letdown was that the pineapple chunks in the fruitbowl tasted not the freshest. The northbound bus stop along the Strip is easily visible from the hotel entrance,but the southbound bus stop is kinda hidden, you need to walk north about 200 feet to get to it. Not a big issue. It is advised to get the RTC bus system pass. We each had the 3-day pass at $15 each. (otherwise, one trip on the Strip bus will cost $3 for adult) Stratosphere hotel guests have unlimited access to the 2 levels (one is open air) of the Tower observation deck at 108 & 109th floors. Access until 1 AM. Shops on the 2nd floor were interesting...the area had a Parisian/Eiffel Tower atmosphere. We watched the light/music show at the Fremont Street Experience, and enjoyedthe (Yesterday band) Beatles concert (lots of songs from 1963 to about 1967) there, too. Refreshing rain on Wednesday afternoon. Visited the Atomic Testing Museum, etc.

Jun 27 2009 	Somewhere else next time.	I new to TripAdvisor, why I am late on writing this: My age 50. Wife and I did not go on a package. I picked Stratoshpere due to lowest price on the strip. It's the first hotel on the strip. The room was just a plain room one price during the week and went up on the weekend. They tried to blow me off and a manager came over found nothing. I pulled out the internet receipt and they got me a room. No sorry, no comp of anything. Went to room just a plain hotel room. Their night club was totally empty except 2 groups of a total of about 11 people on a Friday night. I was just a simple buffet not near as good as a Golden Coral and more expensive that a Golden Coral. Also theirbreakfast buffet long lines waiting for eggs to order they used 1 cook who would often wander off for stuff. Many people would just leave the line and find something else. I plan to try old towne this year 2009. I will try Boyd Vacations Hawaii this year and seeLet me say some good... unfortunately it will be other places.Bellogio: Played slots and got plenty of free drinks quickly.Bellogio: Best steak I ever ate and the waiter was awesome in service and politeness.Calf: Front desk very helpfull when I was looking to move out of Stratosphere.Freemont: Played here and again plenty of free drinks.Old towne Crispy Creme Donuts. While munching donuts the manager came out we engaged him in conversation and he sat with us and gave wife and I friendly advice to enjoy Las Vegas.I going to give Vegas another try but thanks to the Hotel Stratosphere it took me from 2006 now 2009 to want to go back.

Jun 27 2009 	Excellent Value For Money!	We stayed at the Stratosphere at the beginning of June this year and found it to be quite a pleasant stay. Our room was very clean and tidy and excellent value for money. Staff were very nice and helpful. We ate at Lucky's (24 hour cafe), food was tasty and plentiful, my partner just loved the "all day breakfast" for $5.99!! We had a meal at Roxy's Dinner, brilliant atmosphere with great music. We went to see the show with the different stars, two tickets for the price of one, what a bargain!! Lots of good slots and tables. Gym was free, which is a bonus as many hotels actually charge. Yes, the hotel is quite away from the strip, but to be honest we caught the monorail and found this quite reasonable and we were able to nip up and down the strip. "Fremont Street" is a must if you visit Vegas, although very different from the strip, the live music and atmosphere is great!! We enjoyed our stay and would have stayed with them for the full 10 days that we were in Vegas, but unfortunately we found the pool area far too noisy, I agree that Vegas is a 24 hour city, but flying from London UK (13 hours in total) sometimes you just want to rest by the pool! Unfortunately the pool area was blasted with R n B music, don't get me wrong, I love the music, but not when I'm trying to rest!! Shame really....anyway I would recommend this hotel. If you plan to go to Vegas, have fun, we did and fingers crossed we will return next year!!

Jun 26 2009 	Great Fun All the Ammentities of a 5 star hotel for alot less money	The Stratosphere was alot of fun...Plenty of shopping at their mall in the hotel...Plenty of restaurants to choose from and alot of games and slots to play at this casino for less money....We stayed in a Spa Suite with a strip view for what it would cost to get a basic room at a higher end hotel...We loved it...Rooms are modern...I even got to see their cheapest room available and it was roomy and very modern.... The pool on the 8th floor was hugh and a nice setting with poolside bar and eatery with plenty of lounge chairs to relax under the sun.....The Tower with the rides is awesome and would have to say most people visiting Vegas come to see the tower...While you stay here you get to go up for free as much as you would like while others have to pay..Great views, shops, bar and restaurant at top of the tower....All in all...great place to stay with all the ammentities of a 5 star hotel for alot LOT less....

Jun 25 2009 	Overall Great Value	We arrived about an hour before normal check in time and found almost no line. Within 2 minutes we were at the desk. They let us go ahead and check in even though we were early. We got to our room which was in the Premiere tower and it was nice; certainly nothing to complain about. It was cleaned every day as expected. The Casino wasn't as smoke filled as I'd feared so that was definitely a plus. The Stratosphere is a little north of the rest of the strip but it's only a two block walk to the Sahara where there's a monorail station that can take you up and down the strip. There's also a bus stop there if you'd prefer to go that route. The only real negatives we experienced were at two of the restaurants there. Lucky's Cafe had bad service and bad food. Roxy's Diner had good food, but the service wasn't any good at all. One of the days we decided to try their all day buffet for $19.99. That turned out to be a pretty good deal as you can go back as many times as you like all day long. Overall it was definitely a good experience and we got an amazing deal on the room.

Jun 4 2009 	Best Of The Budget Hotels	just returned from a week long stay at the strat, and have to say, it is by far the nicest of the budget hotels on the strip. we went to vegas for my sisters wedding and the travelling paty was split up between stratosphere, circus circus and the riviera. May 25 2009 	Good for the price	The Stratosphere is among the cheapest to stay in while visiting Las Vegas - but, as the old saying goes, you get what you pay for.Probably Stratosphere's biggest drawback is its' location. It is technically on the strip, but it is on the far northern end, with the closest casino (Sahara) being a couple of blocks away. The area between Sahara and Stratosphere can be a bit dicey at night (winos, panhandlers, hookers, etc.) so if you're older or have young kids with you, you will probably want to avoid walking around.I personally didn't have a problem with any of the local color around the Stratosphere, and found that by using the monorail (accessed at the Sahara) you can quickly and cheaply get to the southern areas of the strip. If you want to go to downtown (Fremont Street) you can catch the Deuce (public bus) at all times of day or night. The ride can be slow, but the bus itself is very safe and, at only $3, quite a bit cheaper than taking a taxi.The standard rooms aren't anything special, but for around $25 a night, I wasn't expecting the Ritz. The beds are very comfortable, and the bathrooms are kept clean. You're not likely to get much of a view, and the selection on the TV is very limited, but I come to Vegas to go out, not sit in a hotel room all day. One thing though - the maitenance department needs to improve. During a five-day stay, during two of them, my room was not cleaned even though I had put out the "please make up the room" placard. Used dishes, laundry, etc, would often sit in the hallway for hours at a time. Also, during an afternoon while I was in my room trying to catch a nap, a cleaning person kept running a vacuum directly outside my door, which clearly had the "do not disturb" placard on it.The rest of the staff was better, though. I didn't have any problems checking in - it only took about 10 minutes from getting in line to getting my room key - and checking out via the TV was a breeze.The bartenders, in particular, were very good here, recommending good places to hit, and being quick to comp drinks if you threw in a few bucks into the poker machines. The main bar, C Bar, has a happy hour where you get unlimited drinks from 4-8 PM for $20, which is a good way to get lubed up on the cheap before heading out for the night.I don't gamble much, so I can't really give too many specifics on the casino section. It is surprisingly small, though, compared to other strip casinos, and I thought the sports book looked kind of dumpy. From talking with other people staying at the Stratosphere, apparently they don't have very high payouts.The shows offered, American Superstars (celebrity impersonators) and Bite (topless vampire-themed show), seemed cheesy even by Vegas standards, so I didn't bother with them. Stratosphere's main attraction is the observation deck, which offers an awesome view of Vegas, and the thrill rides, which are extremely fun if you're not scared of heights.I would also recommend the Top of the World restaurant, but go during lunch unless you want to shell out about $100 per person. There are a few other dining options located in the little shopping mall on the second floor. Most of them are fairly nondescript, but a good way to get some good cheap eats - especially the Mexican place, where you can get a big burrito and a beer for around $8.Overall, Stratosphere isn't the best casino/hotel on the strip, but for the price, it's perfectly acceptable. It's a nice place to sleep, shower, and grab a quick bite and couple of drinks before heading out to get the "real" Vegas experience.

May 23 2009 	Once again another good stay... May 22 2009 	2nd stay - Amazing value for $33 per night	Yes its not the bellagio, but at $33 cant argue. No problem with housekeeping, clean every day. May 20 2009 	Great deal with plenty to do but poor location	I've stayed at 18 hotels in Las Vegas, and this one is better than average.I really like the Stratosphere. Apr 27 2009 	Stratosphere staff were useless	I stayed at the Stratosphere for 3 nights after a 5 night stint at the Excalibur. Apr 26 2009 	Would Think Twice	The Hotel itself is so-so, the facilities obviously need some remodeling. The hotel is about 1 mile north of all the action, quite a way to walk. Apr 23 2009 	Good price..great view	Valet service was awesome. Apr 22 2009	Didn't stay here thank goodness	Okay, no we didn't stay at the Stratosphere on our recent trip to LV, THANK GOODNESS! We were with a large group and some of the group did stay there. Apr 18 2009 	Awesome hotel great value highly recommend!	This was my first trip to Vegas, and booked this trip through Expedia. Was a really great deal! Like most people state, the hotel is on the far end of the strip, but that did not prove to be a problem. We rode the monorail and the deuce bus to get around. The hotel is really close to the Fremont Street Experience, only a 2 miles away. When we first arrived, it was about noon, and check in is not supposed to be until 3 pm. They allowed us to check in early, no problem, and there was only a couple of people in line to check in when we arrived. I requested a room on the highest floor available, and they accomodated me on that, was on the top floor. The room was clean, we had a great view of the mountains. I didn't pay the extra $$ to get a view of the strip. Immediately the housekeeper made us feel welcome, very friendly lady. The room size is pretty normal compared to other hotels I've stayed in, and the decor was really nice. Beds were really confortable. There's is plenty to do in the hotel itself. There's plenty of restaurants to choose from, and even a McDonald's for a cheap or late night snack. A Starbucks in the casino. We went and saw the 2 shows they have available at the hotel, American Superstars and Bite. Loved both shows, the impersonators were absolutely amazing. I especially enjoyed Michael Jackson. And the other show, Bite, awesome show. The coreography, the music, loved it. And after each show, you have the opportunity to take pictures with the cast. And the best part is that by staying at the hotel, you get tickets for these shows at half price, which is buy one get one free, so it is a really great deal, 20 bucks per person, you can't beat that.As far as location goes, this hotel is not on the main part of the strip, but that's not to say that's a bad thing. There is easy access to transportation right by the hotel, whether it be the monorail, the deuce bus, or if you prefer, there are plenty of cabs waiting in front of the hotel. Right nearby within walking distance is a Denny's and an IHOP for those of you who like breakfast anytime of the day. I felt pretty comfortable with the location of the hotel. I would advise any of you who do decide to take the monorail, access it through the Sahara Hotel, there's a connection there. Rather than going the back streets which does seem a little unsafe, especially at night. I did not have the guts to get on the rides, but we did get to go up to the tower observation deck, which has a breathtaking view of the city, and at the same time you can see the daring people above you on the rides.Upon checkout, the hotel also offers late checkout at 3pm if you need it, for an additional $20 bucks, which is a great idea if you have a later flight. We utilized this feature, and was great since checkout is at 11, and our shuttle wasn't picking us up until 2:30pm. Checkout was pretty quick, the TV checkout was unavailable, but just a quick call from our room down to the reservation desk to let them know we were checking out was all it took. And just as a last note, I was not charged that $7 daily resort fee that everyone speaks of. I don't know if that was an oversight on the hotel's part, but I have my itemized statement and nothing like that is showing up. The only bad thing I did see is the fact that the hotel charges $12 per day for wifi access. A bit excessive, but I guess for the price of the hotel, you really can't complain too much.I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody, especially if you're on a budget. I had a very good experience here, and would definetly stay here again. Everyone was friendly, hotel room was clean, everything was actually really clean.

Apr 5 2009 	Good for the price but away from the 'center' of the strip	We stayed there in March.
