Both rooms were cleen and simple- good for a place to rest our heads for the night. In the mornings when we would leave the room and put the service sign on the door, if there happened to be cleaning ladies near they would ask if we were going to be gone awhile or for a short amount of time and regardless even if we popped back in to get something we forgot the room was already clean! The cleaning staff did a great job each time of giving us new towels & soaps/shampoos etc and overall did a really good job! All the staff that we encountered were nice & helpful,however, steer clear of the Tahiti Village people. My husband got sucked into the it and signed up, forked over the $40 thinking that we would just go back the next day and get a free meal & show tickets. I read the fine print later and it said that we had to sit thru a 2.5 hr time share presentation which they never told him. We decided not to do it and lost the $40 but we would have lost it gambling anyway I'm sure. The pool was nice- it was during the spring break time so there were quite a few 'kids' there which was fine. The drinks at the pool bar were great and not watered down. Roxy's diner was really good- especially the shakes (and the staff sings too). We went to the top of the tower and my husband did the Big Shot ride and he LOVED it (and he's scared of heights too). Also, if your a guest there you get up to the tower free. The shops & eateries on the upper level were'nt that great. There are two Travelocity.com consierge desks. We went to the one on the upper level to rent a car the day we were leaving so we could go see the Hoover Dam (a must!) and there was a big line and the people infront of us said they had been there 45min and apparently the car rental agency within the hotel ran out of cars and they were trying to shuffle some around & shuffle people to other locations for them! It was a mess. So I went to the one downstairs by the chek in and the girl there was super helpful and got us another rental from an agency off the stip and they picked us up and droped us off free of charge! After eating at they buffet at Excalibur (its HUGE & GOOD) we decided one morning to eat at the Strat buffet. It was really not that good or big- I'd go else where! We also ate at Fellini's which was pretty good, but if your going to spend the money on an Italian dinner go to The Hole In The Wall. We didn't find out about it until after and everyone said it was the best.The Stratosphere Hotel & Casino is at the north end of the strip. by taxi it doesn't take long (a few minutes) to get down to the center. I walked from the Strat to the MGM and it took all afternoon. Also, the tram is super cheap - I think $5 for 1 trip and $13 for an all day pass. It stops at the Sahara which is right down the steet and it runs every 6 mins- the signs for it are all well and clearly marked in the hotels. We never saw any shady people, hookers, or felt unsafe. Take this review as is but let me tell you that I alway read reviews and research things & hotels prior to going so I would consider my review fair & honest.

Apr 2 2009 	Expect to use the bus or tram	My daughter and I stayed at the Stratosphere for 4 nights. It was at least $100 cheaper than any other strip hotel. The service by the pool was great.The casino was small and old compared to the other places I have stayed; Mirage, Mandalay Bay, Treasure Island, Planet Hollywood etc. I have gambled at pretty much all the casinos on the strip including the Rio. Casino service - I was a little mad at the bartender. I was gambling at the bar for at least two hours and getting my drinks free. I had just ran out of credits and ordered a drink, and he charged me $9. The most irritating thing was my players card would stop working, and it always happened after the Rewards Club was closed, so I couldn't get a new card. So if you are going to use the slots, insist on two cards, in case one stops working. They blamed it on being near other cards or my cell phone. I had all my players cards in the same place, and none of the other ones stopped working, or have I had this happen to me before. I have cards that are 3 or 4 years old from the other casinos.For people that said the area was unsafe and had hookers and drug deals going on. Mar 31 2009 	Would Stay Again	After reading most of the reviews, I was quite wary about what we would find when we finally arrived and honestly, I was pleasantly surprised. The only thing we did use that I hadn't read about was that they have a shuttle every night starting at 6:40pm which stops at the stratosphere, miracle mile and one other stop...but it's free and runs til midnight during the week and til 2am on weekends. nice if you plan to out late and don't have to worry about a designated diver. The driver of the shuttle was very nice, gave us lots of tips to avoid and other "must-sees".As for the rest of the hotel, we don't gamble so I can't give any information about the casino. Would definitley recommend if you're looking for a cheaper vegas vacation.

Mar 30 2009 	Avoid this disaster of hotel.	Dont be tempted to save a couple dollars on the price of your room by staying at the Stratosphere  youll pay for it in the end. I am a traveler with experience staying up and down the strip and found myself at the Stratosphere in March 2009 for a family wedding. Prior to arriving the prices on the website looked reasonable and the room photos appeared stylish and inviting. But the pushy yet confused reception I received when booking my room by phone should have been the tip-off that something was not right.The average room  while clean enough  was well short on dcor, space, and for most of my relatives, a view of anything other than a wall or dumpster. My bedroom shared a wall with an elevator that made it sound as though I was sleeping next to a train. I was not warned of this prior to checking in, and the staff didnt seem to think it was a big deal.The staff at the Stratosphere is the least helpful, friendly and knowledgeable you will find anywhere, never mind in comparison to high standards Ive experience elsewhere throughout Las Vegas. The uninterested room service staff finally provided two wine glasses after numerous requests  for a fee of $6. The staff in the tower complained about management throughout my ride up and down. Apparently the Stratosphere is not a great place to work.The casino itself is average and in typical Las Vegas style is impossible to ignore. This would not be an issue, if security staff stopped me no less than two times walking from the reception area through to the elevators because I was carrying my toddler (there is no way to get to your room without crossing the gaming floor).Because the Stratosphere is slightly off strip, you may be willing to sacrifice proximity to the downtown to save a couple bucks. Dont. Any cab ride to the heart of the strip or the airport is at least $20. So unless you plan on staying in the hotel your whole trip (trust me, you wont) this adds another layer of expense.Perhaps the worst aspect of the Stratosphere was its second rate selection of overpriced restaurants. I could go into detail about the lack of selection and the clichd menu options that are priced the same as far superior venues up the strip, but hopefully youre convinced the Stratosphere should be avoided by now.There isnt much this hotel gets right. Thankfully this awful experience is one thing that went on in Vegas and will stay in Vegas.

Calls to the front desk brought apologies and a housekeeper with some liquid to pour down the sink but the problem was never fixed. Further still - the sink isn't in the bathroom, but near the bed. Other than that, if you want to stay in a CASINO hotel, it's fine. (I was later told I should have stayed in the "new" tower. Oh yeah, and they charged me $5 to print out my boarding pass, which I thought was ridiculous. I would recommend the Stratosphere IF you can get it CHEAP!

Mar 27 2009 	Don't say I didn't warn you...	Booked four nights at the Stratosphere for myself and 3 friends flying in from the UK to celebrate a 50th.The hotel sounded like a good deal and I requested a possible upgrade on-line before arrival.I would say the "room" upgrade is more of a "view" upgrade. Unfortunately, the room was far to small for four males (Two of my friends got their own room later that evening), there was no refrigerator, not enough towels etc., for four and a television set from the '90's.All that for about $500 for four nights...Plus an additional charge for wireless internet access!!Our room was close to the elevator which meant there was a constant stream of loud and/or drunk guests outside at all hours along with fights requiring security and police intervention. The front desk staff were unsympathetic when the issue was raised. Generally the staff were pleasant although the bartender was indifferent - when you could get his attention - and the gentleman arranging cabs etc., was outright rude when asked a question.To get to the "strip" you can either use a cab, monorail, bus or walk. To walk you must pass what seems to be an endless pile of trash and debris with waste of every description. NOT recommended. Prices in the hotel (and just about everywhere else) were higher than expected or necessary.I would suggest finding a more central location for a similar price and avoid this hotel if at all possible. Not Recommended at all.

Mar 26 2009	we won't be back	Cean room - indiffrent/incompentent staffAfter reserving two smoking single rooms through Expedia two weeks before arrival, verifing reservations two days prior directly with the Stratosphere staff and reminding the front desk staff at check-in my niece and I were sent to two non smoking double rooms. Had WE not noticed that the rooms were non smoking who knows how much additional we would have been charged. We contacted the front desk before setteling in and received an "apology." We were advised to wait on a diffrent floor in front of two other rooms and that a staff member would arrive with keys and our luggage shortly. We were left loitering in the hall over a half hour. No one showed. After returning to the front desk we were advised two smoking rooms were unavailable. We would have to share a room. We had no choice but to do so- We were later told that our baggage had gone to the two (technically four) diffrent rooms previously assigned. (we had to make the call ourselves to find out why our bags had not been delivered) When we did receive our baggage, a most important item was missing. Four calls later: security, the front desk (twice) and valet services our bag could not located . (Oh, and they were all so nonchalant about the loss) . On the fifth call I got NASTY. The missing bag contained a gift for a birthday party, the reason we were in L.V. Well, the rest of the contents were never located, but lo and behold, the gift showed up. Hummmmmm. Other problems:Room service continental breakfast menu indicated just under $13.00 - final cost $27:00 (now we all expect a service charge for room service,..but almost $15.00 additional?!) - towels and bedding in the hall at 7:00 pm-staff indiffrent and misleading -I won't go into that story, but trust me, I have no reason to make it up. -We were responsible for contacting Expedia regarding the mix up-with the exception of the housekeeping ladies, It was painful to tip any of the stratosphere staff -WE WON'T BE BACK!

Mar 24 2009 	All the comfort for little money	We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel. Granted, it's far away from everything if you have to walk it, but if you have a car that's not an issue. Always plenty of space in the self parkings. For about 36 dollar per night (via expedia), we got a large clean room. The 25th floor pool was closed, but the pool on the 8th floor did the job (renewed, so the water was cold). Internet is expensive (12 dollars/24 hrs) though, so we skipped that. If you have a car and you're on a budget, this is a good place to stay. Hard to find a hotel that offers this value for money.

Mar 24 2009 	Nice Basic Vegas Hotel good value	Not may restaurants here. but rooms were nice and clean with comfy beds. The view was rubbish though! The pool area was nice and quiet but nothing special. Went to the mirgae pool one day and it was absolutely packed and full fo posers so made us appreciate our pool where we played volleyball and had fun. The pool bar does some really good value lunch snacks so well worth it. Good value for money but may be worth spending an extra $20 a night somewhere nearer the main strip as a taxi was around $10 each way to center strip. Was nice to stay here after staying in hostels up until this point.for some reasn our $5 surcharge each day was already included in our booking price which was good. A tip i have is that if you nare planning on going clubbing dont be tempted to pay the touts on the strip anything for their "priority entry" cards. We didnt luckily and discovered that when you go into the casinos or even just outside the have staff handing out entry passes for nothing.

Mar 23 2009 	Disappointing Stay	I booked my one-night stay for $77, including all taxes, through American Airlines Vacations. The Stratosphere is advertised as a hotel located right on the Strip. It is indeed at the very end of the Strip, but it is considered a downtown hotel for taxis and airport shuttles that will charge you an additional rate ($4-10 each way) to get there. After I arrived at The Stratosphere around 11:45 p.m. I was in line for about in an hour to check in. The hotel lobby was filled with cigarette smoke that my clothes, even ones in my travel bag, stank the next day. The check-in person didn't speak good English, so the fact I am from Puerto Rico and speak Spanish came handy. I had specifically requested a non-smoking room with a king-size bed. I was advised the only room available was a smoking room with two smaller beds. After 5 minutes of negotiations I was able to get a non-smoking room. I was tired after traveling from San Juan via Miami all day, and I was not happy to have to argue with someone at 1 a.m. My room was on the 5th floor with no view whatsoever. When I opened the curtains I had a wall just a few feet away from my window that blocked any kind of view, including that of the sky. I spent another half hour getting a BigMac meal at The Stratosphere's McDonalds, and I was then happy to check out 4 hours later. $77 sounds like a good deal, but an extra $5-$10 per night will get you at a nicer hotel, which I would recommend if your stay in Las Vegas is longer than one night. By the way, The Stratosphere charges $11 per day for wireless. What a rip-off.

Mar 23 2009 	Hotel Is Worth the Price But Do Your Gambling Elsewhere	I have stayed at the Stratosphere a number of times. My most recent trip was 4 nites in Mid-March. I booked a Spa King because I love the jacuzzi tubs here. Some people are bothered that they are located in the bathroom, as opposed to the bedroom with a view. For $41 a nite, ($7.50 per nite resort fee included), it is an AWESOME room. I spent approx 14 hours in the tub.Newer, more comfortable beds and slightly different color schemes are the main renovations (November 2008), but the beds are definitely an improvement. Besides the tub, everything else is standard for any 2/3-star hotel.The casino has tightened up on everything from table games, to slots....especially slots. I don't play them much, but always pay attention to see if a casino seems to be paying at least an average amount back to the customers. In four days, I did not see a single win on any slots totalling more than $25-75....that is max bets on machines of every denomination. You will lose $50-100 instantly by playing these machines and not have an ounce of fun. As for the tables, drink service is good, but the dealers (for the most part) are completely inarticulate. Every table I was at had players asking dealers to speak clearer, repeat things, slow down, etc. The pit bosses are surly, and their interaction with their own dealers is awkward to say the least. Dealers are constantly being reminded to do simple things like burn cards, and cut decks. I did play with an extremely friendly dealer though, who was enough to make me look for her again specifically, but I will not be gaming at their casino for a while, and I advise others to avoid it as well. Better gaming on Fremont, or play around on the strip. The rewards progarm is also not great here, which is another reason to game elsewhere.Restaurants: Buffet - closed; Asian restaurant - closed; Roxy's 50's diner - open 2 of 4 days; Lucky's diner - open 24 hours, all 4 days; McDonald's - open 24 hours, all 4 days. The service at Lucky's is always sub-par, but the food is actually pretty good, if you dont mind waiting 20-35 minutes. I have never, and will never eat at Roxy's. Servers sing 50's songs with the style and voice of your average American Idol reject while you try to eat. Seems more annoying than campy fun. Everything else was closed the whole time essentially, which was another downside.The shows are a joke, and the clubs are non-existent as of now I believe....we couldnt find one.Location is not great, but definitely as safe, or safer than other casinos on the strip, (i.e. Sahara, Circus Circus, Imperial Palace). There is a good number of security patrolling things. I walked to IHOP and 711 alone (both 1 block away) during the day, but still wouldnt want to walk alone at nite. Deuce bus is close for cheap, strip travel, and Fremont is close. So stay at the Stratosphere for a quality, clean, cheap room, with friendly service....and thats IT. Eat, gamble, and enjoy shows elsewhere.

Mar 22 2009 	Can't Beat the Value!	For anyone who is considering staying at the Stratosphere to save a few bucks, do NOT listen to the negative reviews. This hotel and casino is definitely worth staying at in order to save a few bucks on your trip. We stayed Sunday through Thursday and when asked if an upgrade from the base room was possible, we were given the option of staying at a deluxe mini suite for only ten dollars extra per night (regularly fifty dollars per night). Our check in took all of five minutes and we were ready to go. The room itself was clean and nice. We did run into a slow draining sink, but maintenance fixed it within five minutes of our call. Yes, the hotel is far from the true strip, and yes you will have to walk a while, but the bus stop is just outside the hotel and is available for only a two dollar fare. Finally, obviously the hotel is not going to be a five star hotel--rooms are going for as low as twenty-five dollars a night--it's not going to be the Belagio, people! BUT it is worth checking out if you are on a lower budget and it still puts you in Las Vegas.Thank you Stratosphere!

Mar 21 2009 	Not bad for a 3 night stay	Hotel was OK, great facilities, staff ok. Restaurant and all eating facilites were great. Hotel gets very very busy in the cabaret bar on the ground floor but atmosphere was good.

Mar 21 2009 	Best place to stay in Vegas if you are on a Budget!!!!!!!!!	This is the best place to stay if you are in Vegas on a budget and do not want to sacrifice location or the "Vegas Experience"The Hotel has gone under renovations and the rooms are definately in the 3 and a half star category. I find that 3 stars in Vegas is more like a 4 star hotel in Canada. Las Vegas hotels seem to be held to a tuffer standard. For example....... a Marriott hotel Alberta might be 4 stars, but a 4 star hotel in Las Vegas is twice as nice........ how does that work?Stratosphere is located at the very north end of the new Las Vegas strip. A short walk across the street to the Sahara hotel where the Monorail starts, and you can take the train to dozens of other resorts on the strip.Stratoshere seems like the best deal if youre on a budget, the shopping, restraunts, nightclub and hotel room rates are some of the best on the strip. Even the "Top of the World" restraunt is good value for what you get, as it is high quality food in an incredable setting high above Las Vegas in the tower, for a price that is better then comparable Las Vegas restraunts of this type. Another restraunt I woudl recomend is the 50's Diner on the main level. The food is wonderful, prices are very competative, and the 50's theme is amazing! The swimming pool is my fav because its got so much space for tanning and so many chairs that you never feel like its too full, theres always a place to lay back on a chair, and a spot in the pool, unlike comparable top las vegas pools. There is even an Adult pool seperate from the main pool area, the adult pool encourages women to go topless. I was there around noon and all I saw were out of shape old women going topless, but it was still fun!Ive been to the Stratosphere 3 times for several days at a time, and i have always found the staff really nice there. Since the hotel changed owners about a year ago, and the new management came in, I have found that the staff are even nicer, some of the most friendly front desk service ive experienced in Las Vegas. The Casino is great, lots of fun games, and a lot of the newer games that are popular, The resort has style and there is a mix of people about 60% chic-style tourists dressed to impress and 40% tourists that dress like slobs.-The only bad things i can say about the stratosphere are that the Hair Salon is a huge rip off, about 5 times as much money to get your hair trimed and styled as comparable salons off the strip and about 3 times as much as the salon across the street at the Sahara Resort. Also, due to the design of the hotel, some rooms have a view of air exchange and conditioning equiptment or views of cement walls 30 feet away.

Mar 20 2009 	Yes and No!!	I stayed here for 10 nights with my partner and therer were some things I was happy with and some things I wasn't. We arrived about 7pm and were checked in within 10minutes, great after I had read about people waiting about an hour.I had paid for a premium view with a king bed. We were told that there were none available and werde given a premium view with two queen beds.The view was of a bad downtown area with nice mountains in the background, I guess its the mountains you pay for. The room was clean not very big but enough for a couple who only wanted it as a base. The housekeeping service was also good. The hotel amenities were decent, nothing special but nothing terrible, apart from the main pool being closed for refurb and the nightclub being permanently closed. The are three bars on the casino level, service in all three was dreadful but I noticed that generally in bars in Vegas there was nothing rushing the bartenders. The location of the hoel is right at the end of the strip, which is 4miles long, and although a 30 minute walk will get you to the main body of the strip, itsd not a nice walk and there is a cheap bus service right outside the hotel. The area around the hotel is a bit rough because its at the cheaper end of the strip, down where the motels begin and the beggers become a bit more aggresive, this is why the bus comes in handy!! The price compared to the main body of strip may cause you accept this, it did for me, but when a tour driver told me that the housing estate beside the hotel has a number of stabbings/shootings a week i though differently, but I didn't see anything like that. In total if you just want a decent hotel as a base then this hotel is fine. I would recommend it too a freind but not a fussy one!!

Mar 18 2009 	Hidden Fee Terrible service Bad location.	I just came back from Stratosphere. We stayed at premium tower room at $73. But we were totally disappointed. And there was hidden fee $ 7.50 for the resort fee. When we booked, they gave us the receipt which is $73 but when we checked out, they said we should pay $7.50 extra for the resort fee. In terms of its room and service, there was no refrigerator. There are only bed and TV and disposable cups. moreover, the heater was out of order. in terms of the service, when we asked for a bottle opener, they wanted to charge $7 to us. Therefore, we went down to the bar to open the bottle but they said we should buy one. It was the worst experience. And in terms of its location, it is located in the strip but almost end of it. You can find much better one with little more money. And one more thing, we thought a premium room of three stars would be better choice but it was wrong. You better go with regular room of four stars.

Mar 17 2009 	Nice for the money	The Stratosphere wasnt the best hotel I've ever stayed in, but within a tight budget we decided to try it out. Though you can get a great deal, you have to take into consideration the cab fare to get to the strip. If you take that into consideration, financially you are better off staying somewhere closer. I liked the staff and the restaurants. I would reccomend this place if you just want to go there, but don't stay there if you are going to spend most of your time in the center of the strip. You really don't save much at all

Mar 17 2009 	Good value for money	After reading several 'negative' reviews on this hotel i decided i would go with a open mind, so yes it isn't the best hotel on the strip but it doesn't claim to be either it is a 3 star but i do think that it is a fair rating.Check in was a little slow but we were there suberbowl weekend and the hotel was extremely busy, so a little wait was to be expected, we were given a room on the 20th floor no view of the strip but a lovely view of the mountains where we saw several lovely sunsets.The room had recently been modernised in tasteful brown and neutral colours, we had 2 queen size beds, t.v, alarm clock, iron and ironing board, hairdryer and a small table and chairsThe downside to the room was mainly that the sink was actually in the main bedroom where you would normally expect it to be in the bathroom.The bathroom was tiny you literally could not move, but on a positive note the shower was very good and there was always a good supply of hot water.My biggest dissapointment was that there was no in-room safe which i think is must in any hotel these days.We ate at the courtyard buffet once for breakfast and then at evening i do have to say the buffet really isn't anything special to be honest we ate much better meals at Dennys nextdoor to the hotel where the food and the service were both excellent.To sum up the hotel i do believe it was good value for money we paid around $23 a night for the room however i would of been dissapointed if we paid more, the location isn't fantastic but the deuce bus stop is right outside and you can be at the heart of the strip within about 10-15 minutes.All in all if you are looking for a resonably priced accomodation on the strip then this would be a good option.

Mar 17 2009 	What a DUMP!!!!!!	I have stayed at cheap hotels, expensive hotels, and middle of the road, places in Vegas and this is the WORST hotel I have ever seen. Here is the deal; the hotel is really far from anything else which is not a big issue by itself. The big issue is that the service is terrible, resturants are BAD and they are hardly open, casio is REALLY smokey, "resort" fee is insane for what you get, the hotel is DIRTY. The same wrapper was in the elevator for 3 days! Staff is rude. Getting a drink is almost impossible. A non-smoking room smells like smoke. The worst part is the noise! Across the street is a roller coaster that runs all day and it rattles the room every 15 minutes. It's like a 747 is landing on top of the hotel. All I can say is BAD, BAD, BAD. Do NOT STAY AT THIS DUMP. You would be much better off at Monte Carlo if you want a mid-price room. Cheap rooms are much better at Imperial Palace.

Mar 16 2009 	Great strip hotel for the price!	After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, I decided to book here, and I am very happy that I did. It was a great hotel! Everything was wonderful from the room, to the dining, to the casino!!It is far away from the main strip, however there are more and more hotels/casinos that are being built closer and closer to the Stratosphere... it wont be long until they build that far. The location isnt as "bad" as it used to be. I liked everything about the room, except the window was smaller than most of the other hotels... but we still had a great mountain view!!

Mar 16 2009 	Reserve a suite if possible	Spent 3 nites at the Stratosphere, stayed in the "Star Suite" and loved the room. This hotel has the longest hallways I have ever seen so I was happy to find out that the suites were right beside the elevator banks. The suite was very big with a wonderful soaker/jetted tub, big enough for two (if you are so inclined). The neighbourhood was a little scary after dark, so take a cab if you plan to leave the hotel at night.

Mar 14 2009 	Great deal for the price!	We went to Vegas for a few days and our stay included a Saturday. We decided to check out the other end of the strip for out last night and stood at the Stratosphere for that night. We were able to stay there for $110+tax, and it was Valentines Day!! GREAT DEAL!! The other hotel we stayed in prior to the Stratosphere was over $300 for that same night. The room was Standard, not a great view... but were weren't there for the view... not that night away. We were there to check out the shows and the thrill rides that are at the Stratosphere. The rides were crazy run and you cannot beat the views. Food was good, show American Superstars was fun - but heads up... the woman who sold us the tickets sold us on tickets closer to the stage because we would get better pictures. Only to find out that one there photos are not allowed. I emailed the hotel about this and they never responded. We were going to say something while we were there, but it was Valentines Day and didn't want the hassel. Over all the hotel was fine and for the price cannot be beat!

Mar 11 2009 	great for the money	we stayed here in april we just stayed for the one night, we wanted to go and see vegas at night from the highest part (apart from going in a helicopter) and we also wanted to try out the rides after dark, the bad points its a bit far out of the way, its a little dodgy at night, be aware of the $7.00 resort fee per night they charge you that after you have booked in,and thats the only bad points that i can find ! good points it offers really good rates, the reception staff are nice upon check in , the rooms arent huge but thay are very clean, the pool is great and clean, the casino is big and the slot machines are quite good at paying out, you get a discount for being a hotel guest to go up the tower, there is a fab resturant/diner called roxys its a cross between grease and happy days it does really great food and its inexpensive try the stratosphere shake but be warned dont try to eat a meal as well as the shake its huge!! we are going to vegas again in 2009 and we will be staying here again for a couple of nights

Mar 9 2009 	Cheap but sometimes you get what you pay for.	We traveled through Vegas on our way back from Disneyland. The Stratosphere had rooms for only $30/night so we decided to stop there. We requested a non-smoking room and it was the smokiest non-smoking room I've ever experienced. So much so that I started to get a migraine within minutes. I called the front desk and they said they would send up a ionizer or something to get rid of the smell. "Alright," I said. 90 minutes later no one had come to the room so I called the front desk, told them that nobody had come and left the room to go get dinner, hoping the smell would be gone when I got back. Needless to say, it wasn't so we requested a different room. The new room was SO much better. No smoky smell. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom was updated. No problems. Just wish they had given us that one to begin with or switched our room the first time I called. Ok hotel. Not great service.

Mar 8 2009 	Good value for the price...	Just got back from a 3 night stay at the Stratosphere - Mar 2 - 5, 09.$31 + tax + resort fee for a 'premium' view room. Ended up in room # 31947 on the 19th floor. View was south toward the strip - the tower and the large Stratosphere front hotel sign obscure the view but you still see a large part of the city which is great.The room was clean, bed ( very good ) & bedding is quite new, tv picture was a bit fuzzy and had limited channels. All in all the room was great especially for the price. Ate at the 50's style diner once which was good and they put everyone through quickly. The 2nd floor where the shops are located has a McDonalds etc which was nice and a cheaper alternative. The hotel gives you a coupon book for properties within the Stratosphere which is nice - mostly 10% off coupons which can add up.Casino is acceptable although can be a bit 'smoky' and has an older smell to it.Check in / out was simple. Parking is excellent if you have a car. I rented from Advantage which I had never heard of. Great rates. Booked right at the airport. $170 US plus gas for 4 full days. Dodge Nitro SUV which was perfect. Shuttle bus takes you from the airport to the car rental place which is about a 10 minute trip. Very efficient.This was my first time to Vegas. Renting a car is great. Easy to drive around Vegas and every casino except Freemont Street has free 'self parking' that has great access.Yes, this hotel is near the North end of the strip. If you plan on walking be in good shape... Again, the rental car option is well worth it.So, the hotel is not new by any means but the price is great, the 'premium rooms' are more than acceptable, the location is not great but rent a car or use the Deuce. You will be happy especially if you will only be in your room to sleep / shower.

Mar 7 2009 	Nice Hotel no service!	We booked a "Premium Room" with view and king bed and without notice they gave us an unrenovated room with no view and 2 queen beds. Some lights, hair dryer and TV did not work. We immediately asked for another room but they told us that there is no chance before next day.Next day we had to make a complete new check in and then we had to wait in our old room for assistance with our luggage. After an hour waiting we moved alone.Next day I got a flu and we asked for hot water to prepare a medicine. They charged us 6 Dollar for 2 cups of some kind of warm water.In this hotel nobody is interested in helping you and thats a pitty, because it is a nice hotel with spacious rooms (the second one with view and king bed) and, surprise, surprise, a lot of entertainment.

Mar 7 2009 	Decent Rooms	As soon as I got off my cab, the bell boy was there to assist me for free. I find the rooms to be reasonably priced. The room was clean and has a good noise insulation. The only drawback is that it's far from the rest of the hotels but since we rented a car, it was not really a concern for us.

Mar 7 2009 	great for the money we paid	just got back from staying a 14night break at the strat. We were on thr 18th floor well impressed with size of room premier view for the total cost of $600 for 14 nights.I would highly recommend for people on a budgetr and it makes a change from the busy centre strip.I have previously stayed at Planet holl, mgm luxor, and treasure island. And it was equal to those in room quality.

Mar 6 2009	Nice hotel 	Lovely hotel at the end of the strip but I just want to advise people to be careful when walking about outside on their own. My stupidity, I suppose but it was broad daylight my husband & I had just got off a bus by our hotel & I said I would go to the shop! I was trying to find a shop when I was beeped from a car parked in a petrol station not that far from the hotel & on the strip , of course I ignored it . I turned down a street next to the hotel because I knew there was a shop there didn't think he would follow me, I am in my 50's but to my amazement he did! He also went past me a few times but luckily the traffic was busy so I managed to get to the shop. I told the staff what was happening & they said it was very dangerous around there & I should not of been there on my own because it happens all the time. (Bear in mind this was only about 5-5.30pm. ) They did advise me of a back way into the hotel & watched me go back. Thank you to them!I heard the next day it had happened to someone else aswell. I only told my husband but I really should of reported it. I know this is not the hotels fault but I just want other TripAdvisors guests & others to be very very careful!

Mar 5 2009 	Great Value For Money	This was my second visit to the Stratosphere hotel. Intended to just stay a week but was so impressed with whole place I ended up staying for 3 weeks during January and February. Had three rooms, all fine and cleaned properly every day. Lucky's restaurant served excellent food with fast, efficient, friendly service. I was in there at some point most days and I really couldn't fault it, all the staff were so helpful. Roxy's Diner is good if you prefer a more lively atmosphere and there are a few other places to eat too, including McDonalds. The buses stop right outside the hotel and run frequently 24 hours a day, going up to the main Strip or to the Downtown area - very convenient. For great value, this hotel is hard to beat. I'll be back!

Mar 5 2009 	You get the little you paid for. BEWARE	Ok so this was our first time to Vegas and we were on a budget! After looking at hotels on the strip and prices we choose to stay here after calling the hotel and the staff assuring it was a quick 10 minute walk to the middle of the stripe. So we booked a standard room with two double beds. When we got there we were so happy to be in Vegas we didn't see anything we didn't like,yet. When we checked in the lady asked us if we wanted to upgrade then showed us a room map of our current room and the suite we could upgrade for only $30 more a night. We did and it was a wise move. Our suite was spacious, two queen size beds, a pull out sofa and a huge and very clean bath room.On our second day the water didn't work on floors 15-24 (we were 23) we called 5 times to front desk said they couldn't do anything it effected all floors. We went to the pool, tanned and hung out for about 4 hours. We missed a full morning of sight seeing. When we got back to our room the maid was still cleaning it so we couldn't go in. It was bout 3 o clock and we still didnt have any water. We called down once again and they said we can go to another room in the west wing. So we walked in the casino, got the room key and found the room. We walked into a very small room- which was suppose to be our room if we didnt upgrade THANK GOD WE DID. The room was small dark and the washroom was so small I could touch both walls with my arms all the way out. We quickly showered and went back to our room. Didn't gamble much at all here! Two hands of black jack and 10$ in slots.The next day our toilet was stuck, called for towels that never came. When we checked out the didnt take anything off for the water not working for one day. Asked the lady to take something off, she took off the upgrade charge for that day. When I got my credit card statement they actually charged us for the room we went to shower in, as well as the upgrade that was suppose to be taken off. Called the hotel and they were confused on how to fix the problem and said they would call me back, which they did 4 hours later.Overall, if you are looking for a cheap place to stay and do not mind taking a taxi to the action part of the strip stay here.

Mar 4 2009 	Decent stay for the price	Just got back from a weekend trip at The Strat. Overall I liked the place. It's clean and upkept. The rooms are very decent for the price $280 for 4 nights!! They served their purpose, sleeping and getting ready... The top of the tower is unbeleivable! Checking in was a bit of a wait. Not too bad. Dotn really remember checking out... There is a resort fee of $7.50/night that you pay when you check in. The pool at the top of the 25th floor was great. Nice and heated with an awesome view. We did pay a crapload of money for cabs cause of the Strats location, and the cabs are expensive anyway. Wouldnt recommend walking around that area at night... better off taking a cab. So Im not sure if we wouldve saved money by paying a little extra to stay somewhere in the middle of the strip and not having to take cab everywhere... They did skrew up our reservation. I had called a few days before our arrival and asked to be close to our friends' room; next to eachother, on the same floor. They said that was no problem and we could be next to eachother with and adjoining door. We got there and they said there was nothing in the system about that. And we were 3 floors apart. But we could switch rooms the next day and be on the same floor. Not that big of a deal. But overall the place was very decent, worth the stay. Go to Luckys!! Good food great prices and quick service!!

Mar 2 2009 	A Return Visit...	This is my second stay at the Stratosphere in less than a year's time and I was completely aware of what to expect, but was actually more impressed this time than on my last visit. I was initially upgraded prior to arrival to a Strip View premier room due to the poor attitude of one of their phone reps when making my reservation. When we arrived, there seemed to be some miscommunication and we were given a World Tower room, which was easily corrected with one phone call.Our room was extremely clean and very comfortable. The bathroom was also very clean and well-stocked. I was impressed with the quality of the linens/bedding and pillows that were in the room - something you'd see at a Hilton Garden Inn or a Hyatt Place, not usual in a "standard" room at a Vegas casino hotel! The 8th floor pool is undergoing a $2M renovation, so they converted the (much smaller) 25th floor pool into a family-friendly area. While we were there it was a bit windy, but there weren't a lot of people around, so there was plenty of space to lay out. I'd definitely go back once the renovation is complete on the pool.All in all, I'd definitely return to the Stratosphere and hope to do so before the year is out!

Mar 2 2009 	Nice place to sleep but that is all	I just got back from my stay at the Stratosphere and was disappointed in it. I had taken a weekend to meet up with friends and have a good time however the nightlife that the Stratosphere offers is a joke. I had been looking forward to Polly Ester's and the Crazy Armadillo but both were a let down. Polly Ester's is closed now (I was told they lost their beer license) and the Crazy Armadillo was dead at midnight on a Saturday. My group were the only ones in the bar except the bar staff which were rude and laughed when were asked where the Crazy Armadillo was. The rooms were fairly comfortable, except our original room in which the floor was drenched and we were told it could take several hours to dry and asked if we could just wait it out. What kind of customer service is that? "Hey, your floor is wet, can't you just wait till it drys?" Over all I'd say pass on the Stratosphere. The shows are so-so, the gaming was bland, the restaurants are run-of-the-mill, and the rooms are just ok. Vegas isn't about par, bland, and ordinary, next time I'll look for something better.

Mar 1 2009 	Great Stay...can't beat the price either!!	I attended the Magic conference Feb. 15 - 19th with a few of my work colleagues, we all stayed at the Stratosphere. I would stay there again for sure, especially for 55.00 a night. Location to the LV Conference Centre is great, you can purchase a three day bus pass good for all routes for 15.00. If you like to shop the outlet centre is about a 5 min. bus ride from the Strat. Catch the bus out front of Denny's.
Mar 1 2009 	Great place	A little out of the way but on the strip with transportation at the door. Very clean good sized room with view of strip. Freindly staff.

Feb 17 2009 	Clean low min tables bad food	We had a beautiful viwe of the city from one of the top floors and the beds were very comfortable! We felt like they had been remodled not long ago. The people that help you at the slots are rude, the rest of the staff is great. Call the concerige to get your return ticket printed. They only have a pay for each min computer and printer and it is a pain. My paper got jammed and no one close had a key. Feb 15 2009 	Stratosphere was Better Than Expected	We stayed at the Strat for a 3 night stay - yes, the Tahiti Village Getaway. We added another room for our two College kids, and upgraded to the tower. Our check-in was polite and very fast since we had the VIP check-in. Our rooms were ready and spotless. Nice linens, clean, nice smelling. The beds were most comfy and the pillows were wonderful ( I travel with my own, but wouldn't have needed to) We ate in the restaurant near the valet parking quite a bit, and when we informed them we were in a hurry one evening, they were most accomodating. One of the mornings we were there, there was a broken water pipe and the hotel didn't have hot water for several hours. Unfortunately, this did affect us, as we had just been to the fitness center in the hotel. So we washed with icy water, but didn't bother to complain (why?....%$&* happens!) About three weeks later, we received a letter giving us a complimentary stay for one night. We aren't going to go, but it was a nice gesture anyway. It is a little far from the center of the strip, but we had our own car, and also used the monorail. The exercise was good for us. Don't miss the rides up top..... quite terrifying! We also saw the cheesy show.... it was fairly entertaining. Very Vegasy.... what else do you need?As far as the TimeShare presentation.... we were very well prepared. I had told every single person that I spoke to from the first "lure" that we didn't plan on purchasing a timeshare, therefore, I had no guilt whatsoever involved when we made it very clear we weren't interested. When they brought over "guy #2".... I emphatically stated that our two hour obligation was up and we were not prepared to speak to any other person. They signed our slip... gave us our tickets.... and we were on our way within two hours. I wouldn't have purchased a unit even if I was a wishy washy person.... they really weren't even that nice I thought.

Feb 14 2009 	Great mid-week package deals	I was looking for an inexpensive pre-Valentine's getaway, so was happy to find package deals at most of the Vegas strip hotels for half to a third of what normal hotels cost in other cities. We drove there, so we were able to save the price of airfare. Our package included an upgraded room, free admission to the Tower, discount show tickets, and coupon booklets. Our upgraded room was a bit worn with stained carpets and old vinyl flooring in the bathroom. We had a view of the parking garage, so I'm worried what their regular rooms looked like. We had to wait in line a half hour to check in on a Sunday evening, so I'd hate to have to check in on a Fri. or Sat! We enjoyed lunch at the revolving restaurant at the top of the Tower. A photographer comes around to take your picture which you can buy for an outrageous price. Views are great though. Didn't try the thrill rides, but they looked scary enough. Also ate at one of their diners, Lucky's, which was fine. The specials are the best deal. The Stratosphere is at the north end of the strip, near a big outlet center. It took us 45 minutes to walk to mid-strip and we ended up taking a taxi back for about eight bucks. Also, a short drive away is Red Rocks Canyon which was beautiful!

Feb 10 2009 	Great Place to Stay	Great stay.-Clean rooms-Nice pool area with bar (busy but not too crowded)-Lots of restaurants, bars and shopping in the hotel-Check in was a bit stressful - woman wrote room # down but didn't tell us what floor it was. Feb 10 2009 	Great Deal	We stayed here for a weekend in January. It was our first time out to Vegas. While it stunk to be a little far away from the strip, the Deuce for $7 you can ride all day long, and the stop is close to the hotel. The rooms were very clean and spacious. We had a great view of the strip from our room. Unfortunatley on the second night we were there (the night after we got married thankfully) I slipped and fell (apparently I'm a klutz) and hit my head pretty hard. The security staff came up, and then called the ambulance for me and unfortunately went to the ER. While of course it sucked having to go through that, the staff was very attentive and did a good job. The only complaint, our room door wasn't closed when we got back. But thankfully nothing got stolen.Besides the trip to the ER, it was a great trip.We also got buy 1, get 1 tickets for the American Superstars Show at the hotel. Feb 9 2009 	Great deal	I stayed here from Friday night to Sunday night, while staying here during the Consumer Electronics Show. I got an average rate of $78/night, which included their resort fee of $7.50 a day, which makes that low rate they advertise initially, not so low in the end.The Good:- I got a very large double room at the lowest room rate.- Room comes with working TV. - Room was thoroughly cleaned every day.- Friendly desk staff- Free admission to Stratosphere Tower.- Free parking- Great view of I-15 from one of the towers.- Very comfortable; no noise issue.- While neighborhood gets a bad rap from other reviewers, not much of an issue if you have a rental car.- With rental car, location from rest of Strip is not an issue.- They let you check out through your cell phone. You have to go to desk to get printout of final receipt though.The Bad:- Resort fee of $7.50 a day.- Long walk from room and elevator to parking lot.- Not most centralized location if you have no rental car.- Early check-out time of 11 a.m.

Feb 1 2009 	Value	Ok yeah its out of the way.. Not good for first timers or second timers.. However, get a players card.. they send me free offers everymonth for the last 3 years.. The offers are good ones. 3 or 4 free nights and a whole lot of freeplay.. slot tourneys.. food credit ect ect.. Cant beat it if your into the freebies.. Honestly ill stay here a few nights then move to another hotel for a few days when i want the frills.. The deals here are worth it. Jan 31 2009	Love it!	I have stayed here twice now and love it. It's clean, the beds are large and very comfy, bathroom was clean and well equipped with towels, food from room service was good and always served within half an hour of ordering. All the staff we dealt with were helpful and friendly (on both occasions) and the views are okay - but to be honest, who wants to sit in their room staring out of the window all the time?! There is FAR too much to do and see in Vegas. I used the deuce bus on my most recent trip but unfortunately, all the drivers were extremely rude - they are obviously sick to the back teeth of tourists, especially from overseas, and it shows. The fares have risen slightly now - $3 one way and $7 for a 24 hour pass. Still excellent value for money - if you are brave enough. There's also the monorail which runs to/from various hotels on the Strip - again, good value for money at $5 a single trip and $13 for 24 hours but you have to negotiate the hotel lobbies and casinos and end up walking miles just to get to the stations. The nearest stop to the Stratosphere is at the nearby Sahara hotel. Sometimes it's easier just to jump in a taxi (always available at the front of the hotel) - they may be a bit more expensive but are much quicker and more convenient.I really would have liked a tea/coffee making facility and mini bar in my room but for the price I paid, I'm not complaining!

Jan 28 2009 	Noisy Stratosphere	This was our first trip to Vegas, as part of a three week road trip around the West Coast. The Stratosphere was the first hotel we came across, so we just walked in, and tried our luck at getting a decent room. We were in luck and we got a suite for three nights for $95 dollars a night. The hotel was a fair distance from the strip, but you could get a bus called the "Deuce" easily which would take you down the strip for around $3. The room was nice, with a Jacuzzi,and a big bed. The first night was great, quiet and we both had a decent night's sleep, but on the second night, the noise coming from the Air Con units on the roof was awful, and then if that wasn;t bad enough, the noise then coming from the water system's within the hotel ensured that we didn't get any sleep for the second and third night. We tried changing room's, but to avail, as they wanted us to move all our things out of the room at 3am in the morning!!! We did get a bit of money knocked of the bill. but not a massive amount, around $50. The staff at the hotel were all pretty rude and unhelpful.

Easy walk to the strip	Help was very, very friendly and helpful. Extremely quiet for how big it is and how many people staying there. Only stayed 1 night but would stay longer. Got me a parking spot for my Harley right out front were it could be watched.

Nov 21 2009 	Rude person on the phone helped us decide to never stay there.	We didn't actually end up staying at this hotel, but after I had to deal with the extremely rude person on the phone I am SUPER glad we did not stay there!First, I made the reservation online. A little while later, we figured out we were not going to make it so we decided to cancel.I called the hotel and the person that answered had a very thick accent, which I don't mind, but I kept having to say "excuse me" because I could not understand her and she seemed very annoyed by that. She told me I had to call the 1800 number to cancel. So I called the 1800 number and the gentleman on the phone said I had to cancel it with the hotel itself because it was after the 24hr window.I called her right back, after she answered the phone and figured out it was me again, she put the phone down, without even asking me to hold for a few minutes. finally she came back and I told her what the guy on the phone said. She raised her voice saying I had to call the 1800 number over and over again, not letting me get a word in edgewise. She finally said if I made the reservation using priceline, orbits etc. that I had to call the number. I told her I made the res. on the super8 website. So she asked for my name and right away starting reading off a number. I asked her what that was and she told me it was the cancellation conf. # like I should have known. THEN all I asked was am I going to be charged any penalties (being that it was after the cancellation period) and she said "MA'AM, WHY WOULD I GIVE YOU A CONF. # IF YOU ARE GOING TO BE CHARGED FOR ANYTHING!" Finally I said "Excuse me I was just asking a question!" Then she went off on me about how I was being so argumentative (which I belief since I couldn't understand her she mistook my "excuse me's" for being argumentative, that's all I can think of). And THEN she said she was going to reverse the cancellation so that I would be charged for the room.Then I basically had to beg her to leave it canceled which was very humiliating. Then I just asked for her name, she said it was Sarah, but when she answered the phone I thought she said Marcy, so I don't know for sure.I hope she is dealt with because who knows how much business Super 8 has lost because of her.

They have a shuttle that did bring us back to the airport and took forver to come to the airport. There is the Ellis Island casino next door, and it has inexpensive gaming and food in the restaurant that actually is pretty good. The room at the Super 8 was clean and we had no complaint about the staff or property.

But there is the very reasonably priced restaurant at the attached Ellis Island Casino next to it. Oct 22 2009 	Not bad for the money	I booked this room through hotels.com because I was told they accept pets and are located near the Strip. I had originally planned to stay at the airport La Quinta, which also accept pets but is not walking distance to the Strip. The reservationist said Super 8 was closer, and had a mid-week special running for $33/night for 3 days so I took it. I've never stayed at a Super 8 and was a little more than leery about the hotel and location. I had no expections whatsoever given the price, but was pleasantly surprised at what $33 bucks could buy.The street doesn't appear to be the safest area especially at night, and has poor street lighting due to large vacant/under construction lots that run along Koval Ln. However, the nearest intersection is so busy with car and foot traffic at all hours that I didn't mind walking to the strip after the sun went down. Just use your common sense. The hotel is 1 (Las Vegas) block from the strip and about a 10 minute walk - or less, if you cut through Ballys at the side entrance. The room was your standard motel room with a flat screen tv, coffee maker, a/c, etc, nothing exceptional. The linens were clean, but I noticed the boxspring/mattress had various stains at the side. I guess as long as the sheets were clean, I didn't need to know or see what was underneath. The hall carpets were stained but my room was clean and okay. I discovered that all 3 icemakers on all 3 floors were broken, which was a disappointment, however, on my 3 day they replaced them with new ice machines. All the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.I think if you have no unrealistic expections, you wont be disappointed. I mean, you do get what you pay for, and if we all had the $200 to $300+ per night to shell out for the Bellagio--we would, so I have no complaints. It's a good deal if you only want to crash for a few days, and don't intend to spend much time in the room, but just to sleep. The pros are the proximity to the Strip and being able to park your car directly in front of your room. They also have Ellis Island next door, open 24 hours. I didn't eat there, but looked at the menu, which was inexpensive and had the standard Denny's-esque food items. It was fairly busy, and the patrons seemed to be locals.The one con that may be a big deal to some (besides the obvious lack of any semblance of luxury) is the dark unlit street. A couple street lamps couldn't hurt, and the creepiness factor may intimidate some people. There were a few homeless panhandlers hanging out at the corner Arco and at the bus stop across the street, but not unlike the many homeless you see on the Strip asking for money. It's just that seeing a few on a dark desolate street seems more ominous than the ones you see on the busy well-lit Strip. They didn't bother me and I had no problems. It was an overall pleasant stay for a few days and a few bucks.

Sep 19 2008 	Good value for a budget hotel	We stayed at this hotel twice during our USA vacation, on the day of our arrival to the USA and again on the night before our departure. Aug 30 2008 	Experience Vegas on a tight budget ..try Super 8	-This hotel is very basic and definitely suits the budget.- Its about a good 10min walk off the strip to Bally's. -Rooms were small but well air conditioned. -Beds were not that comfortable, halls smelt very muggy and musty and not well lit.- No continental breakfast had a hot beverage dispenser but that was it.- Good free airport shuttle which is very helpful but BOOK night before.- Cabs will not pick you up there they are all on the strip but its about a 5$ cab ride from Bally to Super 8.-Front desk was rude and not that helpful except for the odd person..depends on the time of day.-Room keys never worked always had to get them re programed every time we got back. and were locked out from the pool.-Pool was refreshing after a long hot day but it was small and had a terrible location.-taps in shower were confusing and backwards.- 7-11 is close by and great to run and pick up a quick breakfast or coffee.Overall its great on a tight buget and when you are not spending a whole lot of time at the hotel. Feb 24 2008 	Debit Card Fraud	We were visiting US from Europe. We were on our way to Grand Canyon and we've decided to spend the night in Las Vegas and continue our trip in the morning. So what happens next second is that the guy swipes the card through the reader without saying anything. So we were NOT asked if we would like our credit card to be used! We get to our room and we check the bank account and we see that 600$ more than the price of the room was taken from the account!! We get down to the reception to ask if they took it. The answer was 'no'. But they DID take the money! There was another weird thing about the payment. We were told that the price was 75$, and after the card was used we got something to sign where it was said that we payed 75$. Later we saw 682$ were taken. When we asked the thief how much he took he said he took only 82$ which is for 'security reasons' and he will put back 7$ tomorrow if everything is ok with the room. But in the morning some other person at the reception said that 82$ was 75$ + tax! So we got a 'receipt' from the thief saying 75$, but they officially took 82@ but what they really did is that they took 682$! Oct 21 2005	Great value 'no frills' really near the Strip	If you want somewhere good value, clean, comfortable and safe with polite helpful staff near the Strip, I would recommend this hotel although it's not for those who want fluffy white bathrobes in their rooms and the other frills you get if you pay more.I stayed here for a family wedding. (I reckon I was on the strip in not much less time than it owuld have taken me to get down there from a room at the Bellagio once you had taken into the account the lengthy corridors, waiting for elevators etc etc).check-in was fast and easy with no queues, they had internet access (expensive but good that it was available) and free coffee in the lobby (be warned, Las Vegas hotels don't seem to supply the tea and coffe making facilities beloved of English hotels). An added bonus is the very blue-collar small Ellis Island Casino which is apparently where the locals go to gamble. They make their own beer, the steaks are meant to be great value (although I never got to try one). Being an Englishman in Las Vegas, I also quite liked being near 'real' things like the local 7-11 which meant I could buy bottled water and food etc as pretty good value (such places exist on the strip but are relatively few and far between).I felt pretty safe walking around this area even late at night although you do see the occasional signs that you are away from the wealth of the Strip - eg poor crazy people yelling at traffic, mumbling to themselves etc.On a general note re Las Vegas, it's amazing how long it can take to walk from one hotel to another even though they appear quite close on the Map which might be worth bearing in mind if you are working out where to stay. I don't know if all Super 8's are like this, but you access your room on the inside of the building, so you can use an elevator if you're not on the first floor. May 29 2006	A dump for sure but if its all there is and you don't need much it may work.	I would never stay here by choice if I were looking for a vacation room (to give you an idea of my lodging tastes, I often prefer places such as Springhill Suites or Hilton Garden Inn for nice accomodations at a good value, and on occasion stay at very upscale hotels if a value rate can be found (Royal Palms, etc.)), but this Super 8 served our purpose on a return from a backpacking trip in Utah before a 6:45 am flight out of Las Vegas. Bear in mind as you read this, we were three guys who had been sleeping on the ground in canyons for four nights -- I would not consider this hotel at all if I were with my family.As it was Memorial Day, this was the only place we could find to stay, without spending a fortune for very last available suites and rooms at a few nice places. We paid $100, a bargain compared to other quoted prices. The front desk staff was courteous enough. Our room was on the first floor located about 6-7 doors away from the lobby and their run down, depressing casino. The smell of mildew and must will hit you as you walk the hall, but our room actually did not smell much of mildew (some cigarette smoke came in at times - I hate smoke, but it was bearable, if that gives any insight to the amount coming in). To the eye, the room was visibly clean, as were the towels. Don't know about the comforter, as I pulled it off the bed (doubt they ever clean those), but the sheets appeared to be clean (slept in long pants and socks, nonetheless, to be on the safe side). Toilet had a flush problem, but we quickly fixed it oursevles by tinkering with the flush rod. Shower was clean, but a portion of wall in shower looked damaged. The room had no alarm clock, but they provided a wake up call on our request. TV worked fine, but remote was broken. Pull rod on curtain was broken. Several people appeared to be enjoying the small pool in the front of the hotel. Didn't feel safe enough to keep anything in the car, but don't know that I would anywhere in Vegas. On the other hand, if it gives you a bit more of an idea about the place, I did in fact wonder aloud whether it would be safer to leave our stuff in the car or the room as we left to hit The Strip for a few hours -- but I felt it was okay to leave it in the room and we had no problem at all.This Super 8 is in what appeared to be an okay part of town, very near to Sam's Town Casino on Boulder Highway on the east side of town just north of Henderson. Sep 12 2009 	Great little hotel for a low price.	We stayed here on Saturday night of Labor Day weekend. We paid $79 through Priceline. This was our second time staying here. Sep 5 2009	Car Damaged in Garage: Management Indifferent	I wanted to like this place, and did until my car was damaged in their parking structure, and they responded indifferently to this incident. Parked in the parking garage 8.19.09, 12 hours later, theres this whitish liquid on the back and side of my car. It wouldnt come off. Either vandalism or something dripped from a crack in the ceiling above my car. Security took a report, said Id be contacted within 72 hours. I wasnt. Called back, got a lot of, thats not my department. Left NUMEROUS phone messages with various staff. One guy tells me security footage is retained for one year, another guy doubts this. Great, nobody knows their job. Just my kind of place. Two weeks later a manager calls. Says that their investigation found nothing unusual on the tape, and that the casino is not liable. I asked if I could review the tape. He said Id have to talk to his boss. His boss tells me that my car wasnt even observed on any of their security cameras during this period. So which is it? First guy tells me it was observed, no damage, second guy tells me it wasnt even observed. Fishy. I ask if a camera is normally positioned on the area where my car was parked, as it is in a prominent, highly visible area. He replies, direct quote, thats none of your business. I ask a few more times, he grows impatient, and hangs up on me. If you asked this guy if air exists, hed hang up on you, thats how helpful he was. So here I am, one manager said my car was seen on tape, and nothing unusual was observed, his boss tells me my car wasnt even observed, and that the issue is none of my business. Who do I believe? Given the inconsistencies, I can only conclude that they just arent honest. Is this their idea of good customer service? So Im left with damage to my car and a $250 deductible. Ive sent this EXACT review, verbatim, along with pictures, and a detailed accounting, asking for a response. A reasonable, consistent, professional response. They have not acted in good faith. I just want sort of reasonable clarification. If I get it, Ill update this review. If not, Ill think what I think today, which is that the name fits: Terribles.

Jun 15 2009 	Certainly Not Terrible !	Was a bit hesitant when booking this hotel especially with the name to go along with it, was looking for a budget hotel for a 4 night first time stay in Vegas with 3 friends, we booked 2 queen rooms (2 in each room).The hotel shuttle was great, i didnt see many other hotels offering this, we had to wait quite a while for it though upon arrival at the airport, over 30 mins, although we did land late around 11pm on a wednesday night. It was a short 10 min ride from the airport, knowing that we could have easily got a cab and saved the waiting, the shuttle on the way back to the airport was perfect, we ordered it at the front desk and was there right on time. There was huge car park out front too that always had parking spots.On checking in we didnt have to wait long, they said only 1 of our queen rooms was available at the moment so they apologised and put me and my friend in a ground floor "suite" can you say BONUS !!!! it was fantastic, the desk said that our queen room would be ready the day after if we wanted to come back and get the key....not a chance !!! the suite was awesome, with 2 seperate rooms, 2 plasma's, a gambling table, fridge, jet tub, walk in shower, king bed, walk out to a double sized patio from either room, we totally loved the room and made our trip more special, hence to say we avoided the front desk for the rest of our stay so they wouldnt move us ! the queen room that our friends had was ok, no complaints, plasma, good sized bathroom, 2 queen beds, nice view of the pool area.The pool area was nice and was never busy, in fact we only ever saw a handful of people round it, it was nice and big and lined with palm tree's, a very nice setting.the hotel was relatively quiet compared to the strip, you couldnt hear any noise late at night, the casino was great, although not too big but had everything you needed, some good low rate tables too and plenty slots, the bar in the casino was good too, it offered happy hour drinks every day from 4-7 that were $2 draft beers , awesome deal.We ate at the restaurant in the hotel on the first floor every day, the food and value for money was fantastic, the portion sizes were enormous, even at breakfast, for the price it couldnt be beat and the selection on the menu was the largest ive ever seen, a steak and egg breakfast would only cost us $5 and an evening meal you could easily eat for under $10. it was never busy and we got a table right away every time. They even have their own brand of Terrible Ketchup and brown sauce and Terrible wine.It was a good 15 minute walk to the strip which brought you out at Bills/Ballys, we got a cab a few times and was only $5 or so, especially late at night we didnt fancy the walk back, For an off strip hotel the distance wasnt too far i expected further. There is a walgreens or 7/11 i cant remember, right across the road where they sell beer and all the usual things, we would stock up our fridge in our room instead of buying things in the hotel during the day.All in all we never had a single complaint about the hotel, except my friend who saw 1 tiny cockroach upon arrival in our room, we never saw a single one after that. i would definatly reccommend this hotel if you want a low budget hotel thats off strip and a bit quieter (although the casino was always busy)Definately NOT Terrible and will stay again there in a heartbeat !

Jun 9 2009 	best comps in Vegas	Traveling with my mom and had 4 nights comped at the Flamingo through total rewards -Didn't work, apparently my husbands name was the only one on the account so they wouldn't honor the offer (funny I got all the e-mails in my name). May 29 2009 	Worked for me.....	OK folks heres my "recent" review of Terribles.....I got there Sunday the 24 th @ 3 p.m. and there was NOBODY in line for check-in (sweet) check-in was FAST !!! I was off to my "standard" room within minutes, the older room was very clean w/a large flat screen tv, coffee maker ( I do not drink coffee) hair dryer etc. there was however a mystery stain on the carpet I figured out to be wax (no biggie) other than that the room was just fine for me, it was a smoking room and still had no real strong odor, now for the maids, I swear they knew when I left the room! one morning I was gone 1.5 hrs. and came back to get something and it was clean and smelling good!! I never even seen them (?) I remember "other" Vegas hotels having to wait until 4-5 pm to get the room cleaned ( you all can relate) Now the casino, YES it does smell of cigs, but hey, its a small older casino and theres smokers ...its not THAT bad as others lead on to be, the slots were good not great but good, they keep you playing and do pay out, just gotta know when to cash out! duh... I did go to see my aunt @ Ballys and won $1585 !!! on the slots..woohoo. Ok now food, the buffet was Hmmmm OK , room service ( yes room service) was good I got the Turkey Club w/seasoned fries ( VERY GOOD) and the total was $11.06, I do not think that was too bad seeing how I was in a hurry and needed quick food, there were there within 20 minutes!....the parking was good ,SAFE and very quick trip to room etc. I saw they had a shuttle to/from airport but never used it, also, I needed a cab one day and waited and waited out front only to see there were NO cabs around (?) I went to the front desk to ask about a cab and she said she'll call one, no sooner did I get to the front door the cab was there! (nice) so folks, all in all Terribles is a fine place, for the $25 a night I paid ( Hotels.com) it was worth it , No Drunk Fratboys, No kids, No Snobs just regular people like me who want a cheap/clean QUIET place to gamble. Oh, one last thing ( I could kick myself ) I never got a players card, GET ONE, they give you a coupon book w/it that has all kinds of goodies..Oh, just one more thing, the pool is very nice.

May 29 2009 	Best deal for me	At a fraction of the cost of any hotel on the strip, a few blocks away, this is a great deal. I save enough on rooms to get a rental car for the whole week and still have hundreds of savings( to gamble). The casino and restaurants are modest, with the money I save I just jump in my rental car and eat and gamble at any casino in the city, the savings are enormous. May 27 2009 	Value for the buck	I was travelling with a group of co-workers. I could get comp rooms on the Strip for midweek, but not the weekend. I had no problem moving down the road to save a couple of hundred bucks. Others opted to stay at Bally's for $210 a night, I went with Terribles for $64. I have stayed here before and have never been disappointed. I arrived around noon on Friday and asked for a third floor courtyard room with a king bed, which they had ready. I brought one of my fellow travelers along with me. He was curious to see what kind of room you get in a place called Terribles. He was pleasantly surprised; spacious clean, and comfortable. I think he was asking himself why he was paying three times more for a comprable room down the road. The room has a flat screen TV and a coffee maker. The courtyard rooms are quiet. One thing I love about the rooms is that the windows open. Unless it is oppressively hot, I prefer to sleep with fresh air coming in, rather than an AC blowing. You can't find that in too many places on the Strip. The one weak link in the room is the bathroom, it is tiny. But when you are by yourself, that is really not an issue. (The tower rooms have larger bathrooms). I love the casino, it has all my favorite games. I cannot find Spin Poker on the Strip, Terribles must have a dozen of them. The pool is peaceful and relaxing. Go out anytime during the day and there is no problem finding a chaise in either the sun or shade. Cocktail service is abundant. The breakfast buffet is great; fresh waffles and an omlette station among other things. And during my time I earned enough points to pay for one night's accommodation and two meals. With taxes, I paid a tad less than $70 for the weekend. My friend's bill approached the $500 mark. If you don't have a car, you are looking at either a $1.75 bus ride, $10 taxi ride, or 1 mile walk to the Strip. (However, they do have a free airport shuttle.) You also get the ambience of locals casino which means a little less bling and a bit more smoke. But all in all it adds to the experience. I love this place and will continue to come here for great gambling and unprecedented value.

I have stayed in the older rooms since they are so inexpensive. The rooms are clean albeit older. The pictures shown by the property are of the newer, tower rooms. You have to walk through the casino to get to the Cafe or buffet area. You can literally see the smoke cloud in the casino and in the Cafe. I have bad allergies and can't handle it. I just skip them. My sister smokes 2 packs a day. She even concedes that it's incredibly smokey. That said, the food is super cheap, but not very good. It is open 24 hours though.We typically walk up to the strip. Don't let looks deceive you. Although you can see the Flamingo, it takes about 30 minutes to walk up there. You will arrive by the Flamingo, Ballys, Caesars and the Bellagio. We usually cab back. You can walk across the street to the Hard Rock Cafe and take the free shuttle to the MGM grand. The shuttle runs every 30 minutes or so.Terrible's also has a free shuttle to and from the airport. If you cab from the airport to Terrible's, it is less than a 5 minute ride. Do not let the cabbie take you on the Freeway down to the strip. You should by-pass the strip completely. Oh, and the cab fares are based on TIME not distance!If you are looking for cheap food/drink on the strip, there is a CVS, McDonalds, Chipotle across from the Mirage and a Walgreens up by the M-n-M factory across from New York New York. Within walking distance of Terrible's you will find Bahama Breeze, PF Changs and Cozymel's restaurants. All are tasty but can be a bit pricey. If you're looking to stay cheap and can manage to get through the smokey atmosphere and up to your room, then Terrible's is worth the price. My family and I have stayed there 6 times now. Although I hate the smoke, the price makes up for it.

Jan 25 2009	best little casino in town	we really enjoyed staying at terribles been to vegas 12 times and always stayed on the strip, it was sure nice to stay some where a little quiter. the food was excellent, the rooms were clean and very nice, i dont have one bad thing to say i will be staying there again.

Jan 18 2009 	Good Value Decent location	Terrible's was better than expected. They have Motel 6 prices but the rooms are very clean and well maintained. Jan 10 2009 	Extremely Pleased with My Pick Terrible's in Las Vegas	The Consumer Electronic Show is this weekend in Las Vegas. Towels and toiletries were more than sufficient.Location: It is located on the Corner of Paradise and Flamingo, coordinates are N36 06 49, W115 09 11 according to GoogleEarth. Dec 1 2008 	So so..
